Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: evalew
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in Paris so we don't have much to compare this hotel too, but we thought it was lovely! The rooms were clean and well kept, extra pillows, separate toilette from the shower area. We were on the back side of the hotel, and it was quiet which made for a peaceful nights sleep. Staff was friendly. The stairs were steep, but there is a small elevator if you need it. Staff brought our bags up for us. Water pressure in the shower was good, and it was always hot enough. We found it to be a very charming place! The room isn't gigantic, but we assume it is fairly on par for other places in Paris (especially for a hotel that had a bit more of a historical feel to it). It is also close to a couple of metros, which is convenient. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, charming building, but minimal amenities and room very small”
Reviews.Author: hikkirocks
Reviews.Content: My mother and i stayed here for 2 nights during our 1-week stay in April 2012 in France. Overall a wonderful stay and the cost performance (around 150 euros/night for twin shower) is excellent! Pros: Location - walking distance to metro, only 8 euros by taxi from Opera Roissy Bus stop. Service!!! - such friendly and attentive staff. One example is when we asked to arrange a cab in the morning on our last day, the staff came to our room to let us know the cab was about to come, and took our luggage. Such efficient and smart service. Couldn't praise enough about the service, from the booking process to the end. Wifi- no dramas. The kind you can just select the network and enter the password, not the one you have to log in every time on a web browser. Character - the exterior and interior are just beautiful. Lovely, warm and welcoming reception area. Cons: The only thing is the room (twin standard shower) was quite small, and there were no shower amenities i.e. shampoo etc. nor was there a fridge/ kettle. I only mention this because for the same price range there was another hotel we stayed at whose room was much bigger with more amenities, albeit having much LESS helpful staff. Overall an excellent stay. I'll come back, if I can book as it seems very popular, and rightly so! Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Manchesterlass12
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a long weekend at the New Orient Hotel mid March and everything about this hotel was wonderful due to the attention to detail that Catherine (the owner) and her husband Josef have put into it. The hotel is their pride and joy and this shows in the decor, furnishings and the typical French atmosphere that they have created. The hotel has a great friendly feel and every member of staff that we met seemed to genuinely want to make our stay as special as they possibly could. Our room was spotlessly clean and well decorated, and looked out onto the main street. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is considering a trip to Paris. It is a little off the beaten track, but all the main tourist attractions are within walking distance or a short taxi drive away - it cost around 10 euros from the Eiffel Tower to the hotel. Thank you to Catherine, to Josef (for his advice on some different, less touristy places to visit) and all your great staff for making my 50th birthday present a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly / Helpful Staff - Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kmuffins7
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here for a week in March 2012.... The staff at the front desk was quite helpful with metro directions & suggestions. The free wifi was a life-saver since I'm an iphone user, and roaming charges can be quite costly without wifi. I was offered a wonderful tea service upon arrival, and for my birthday they left a wrapped gift and a card on my bed. So sweet! There's a supermarket across the street where you can get a variety of snacks and a good bottle of wine for less than 5 Euros. There's a wonderful creperie a couple of doors down and a Venetian pastry shop with the most delectable croissants and tarts. The metro station "Europe" - Line 3 is really close (less than 5 minutes walk). The only issue is that the room / bathroom were really tiny. However, the nightly rates were so good that I really couldn't complain about room size!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel at perfect price”
Reviews.Author: CharlesKelly
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the New Orient Hotel for three nights in January. We were impressed the moment the elegant Hausmann-style hotel came into view through our taxi window. The front desk staff were welcoming and helpful on arrival, and immediately put to rest our concerns about getting around Paris with rusty French. Those good feelings continued when we opened the door to our very comfortable room. What could be nicer than standing on the balcony and taking in the Parisian street scene below? The room was tasteful and more than adequately sized considering the dimensions of the usual Parisian hotel room. The bathroom was well-appointed and the bed was very comfortable. Access to free Wi-Fi made planning our trip around Paris a breeze. Each morning, we enjoyed the self-serve continental breakfast served on the ground floor. Service staff were always very helpful and the selections were fresh and tasty. And the freshly made bread is to die for! As well, the front foyer is well-stocked with useful travel information. One of the reasons we chose the New Orient (after consulting TripAdvisor) was its handy location in the 8th arrondissement, and we weren't disappointed. The Europe and St Lazare metro stops are a short walk away through the Parisian music district, as is Gare St Lazare. From there, all of Paris is available to you, as well as the train to Versailles. We have no reservations whatsoever about recommending the New Orient Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Bob1453
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves all the good reviews. The hotel is well kept, the staff are friendly and for a standard level of comfort it ticks all the boxes. Rooms were clean and tidy and the furnishings generally comfortable. The location is a bit too far from the centre of Paris to walk anywhere but there are metro stations nearby that mean this is never an issue. The only real problem we encountered was room temperature - the air con temperature was non adjustable and at night we had the choice of getting cold sleeping on top of the bed or being too warm sleeping in it as there was only a thick quilt, with no option of just a sheet! This made sleeping a little difficult at times but as it seemed unseasonably warm while we were there, this was probably just bad luck!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Paris hotel good for a short break”
Reviews.Author: DaffyBrightonUK
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel close to a metro stop and easy to get to all the main sites. The rooms themselves are not huge but certainly not tiny. They are beautifully clean and the room we had looked out on to the main street although there was little traffic. It was on the first floor of the hotel and you could hear the metro running under the hotel! Would be best to request a high floor room if this bothers you. The beds were comfy and all the staff in the hotel were really helpful. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning, which was nice and there are many cafe's around the hotel that you could go to. The main attraction that this hotel offered was the great value it gave in comparison to other hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best value ever!”
Reviews.Author: RoidEcosse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the New Orient for 5 nights and were absolutely delighted with it. I'm not going to write a long review on this, because everyone else has pretty much said it all before: suffice to say that the hotel is the best value hotel we have ever used in Paris; it's in a great location; the owners are brilliant; the staff are so friendly; the rooms are perfect; the beds are heaven; and if you do have the buffet breakfast it represents excellent value for money. Never have we been made to feel so welcome in a Paris hotel (in any hotel, for that matter, but Paris hoteliers are notoriously indifferent). As far as we are concerned, on the assumption that nothing changes, we won't go anywhere else in Paris in future. The New Orient has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, quiet rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jjddss
Reviews.Content: Many reviews have it right. They have great sound-proof windows, and firm comfortable beds. We slept as well as we do at home---possibly better. There are three metro stops nearby, markets and restaurants. We walked up t Montmartre and easily took the metro elsewhere. The shower is also good. This has nothing extra, but clean, comfortable rooms and all the basics done very well. Just what I want to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HPBKraaijeveld
Reviews.Content: Indeed a nice hotel. Good value for money.Great location. Staff is most friendly and helpfull. Good size room and bathroom for Paris' standards. Very clean and good beds. Good breakfast at a moderate price. Stayed here just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane P
Reviews.Content: I was staying in New Orient hotel in January. The hotel was very cozy and clean and I think it was the best choice for reasonable price. However do not wait too much: rooms are small - like everywhere in Paris and noise insulation is not on the best level. But hotel is very nice and staff is really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice”
Reviews.Author: Adidi_12
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Paris with my 11 year old daughter. The hotel was everything we hoped for and more. We wanted to be well located, to have a nice, cosy place to call "home" away from home for a week. It has very comfortable beds, a nice room, great view. We brought in the table and chairs from the balcony and ate snacks in the room. There's a market up the street and it's located near 2 Metro stations and bus to the Arc de Triumph. The hotel owners and staff are friendly and gave us excellent service and plenty of great detailed support in English. I longed for hot baths and warm cosy beddings...such a lovely hotel. Very well priced. We didn't understand why it only boasts 2 stars...it deserves more.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Parisian”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on our way home from a few days in Provence, We booked on the strength of the reviews on Trip Advisor and had an absolutely wonderful time. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, the staff extremely friendly and helpful and the location perfect for exploring this wonderful city. The area felt totally safe and clean with several Metro stations nearby. Cafes, restaurants and bars are within easy walking distance, We would not hesitate to return to this gem of a hotel...go on, treat yourself! Why stay in a bland 'chain' hotel when you could live like a Parisian for a few days?

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Xabbu
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you surprising value for money for a Parisian hotel. The rooms are small and the stairs are quite "adventurous", but everything is clean and comfortable. The location is great - we walked from the hotel to the Champs Elysee, the Louvre and to Sacre Coeur. Furthermore there are 3 different Metro stops in the immediate vicinity. We had the breakfast on 2 days and I felt like it was pretty good. Not overly exciting, but for 8 Euros a fair offer. Overall I would really recommend this hotel for your stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: susiej252
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel for two nights in February 2012. The staff is fabulous and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and clean and the hotel is not far from the bus or metro stops! By Paris standards our room and bath were large! The breakfast was a lovely french meal with warm croissants, breads and pastries as well as a variety of dried fruits, cereal and yogurts and meats and cheeses! Do not hesitate to book a room here! You will not be sorry! Oh and try to get a room with a balcony! Charming!! This hotel should have 4 stars!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Helen B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last weekend for three nights in a double room. The hotel was well located within walking distance of the metro stop at Europe. The room was small with a nice en-suite and a lovely little balcony with a small table and two chairs which was a lovely touch. The staff were friendly and welcoming. There are a number of restaurants within walking distance but of note this area is very quiet at the weekend which suited us. Overall a nice place to stay and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL LOCATION, A1 PRESENTATION”
Reviews.Author: Michelle S
Reviews.Content: An excellent place to stay - walking distance to most places - we wore ourselves out walking. Attention to detail - Lovely flowers and a note awaited us on our arrival for our 30th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “A feeling of the real Paris”
Reviews.Author: Gloria A
Reviews.Content: Quaint, neat, very local, nice personnel, and a cozy and homey atmosphere. This truly was one of my best hotel stays ever: it was so... personal. I will never forget it, and I will most probably return. I even blogged about it :) http://thegloria.wordpress.com/2012/01/30/paris-boudoir-art-nouveau-prix-damerique/

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable that this is a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moniquebarr
Reviews.Content: For a two star hotel the New Orient certainly deserves its five star Tripadvisor ratings. I initially booked for five days, but liked the hotel and Paris so much that I extended my visit by another five days. The rooms are sparkling clean, cozy and tastefully decorated with antique furniture. Further, the maid service is unsurpassed, and the front desk staff is charming and helpful. I imagine that the stairs are a little bit tricky if you’re carrying heavy luggage, but the front desk kindly had my luggage delivered to my room – so this wasn’t a problem for me. The hotel is located a little bit off of the beaten path but, in my case, after a long day of site seeing, I was happy to return to a quiet, upscale neighbourhood. Further, there’s a lovely park nearby (Parc Monceau) where one can people watch while enjoying a picnic. Delicious sandwiches etc. can be purchased at the nearby outdoor market. My only quibble about the New Orient hotel is the breakfast offerings. They were a bit spare and, as a result, I would advise eating elsewhere. Luckily, there are many fabulous restaurants in the neighbourhood and a grocery store right across the street. If and when I return to Paris, I will definitely stay here again. A word to wise – despite the fact that it was February the hotel was almost fully booked, so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Valentine Weekend”
Reviews.Author: beeproject
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous about room size and location when we first book this hotel. The room were unexpectedly larger than we thought! Although I must say that we were both very small so the size of the room was not a problem for us. We arrived very early in the morning but the maid worked hard to get us in our room early. Also, when we came back to our room, the bed was neatly made and the teddy bear I brought along with me during the trip was placed on the bed, facing the door to welcome us home! So cute! Both Amar and Catherine were very friendly too. If you ever met Amar, ask him about Berber, his native language. He will tell you fascinating history of the origin of his people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with friendly and knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: YGrandage
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights around Valentines Day, the hotel staff were very welcoming, and the rooms were comfortable and clean - the free WiFi was a bonus. The location is very handy for visiting the main Paris sights whilst still retaining a 'local' feel, there are loads of nice restaurants and bars near by on Rue de Dames, and the local market on rue de Levis is great to wander through and drool over the lovely food!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property, Gracious Hosts”
Reviews.Author: Sheri W
Reviews.Content: Owner Catherine was very gracious in providing directions and also in recommending Chez Gabrielle for dinner. Room was just as described -- charming, comfortable and cozy. Location was walkable to public transportation that we used to enjoy sights of Paris. Good local dining options. Definitely recommend and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “best romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ploik000
Reviews.Content: One of the best romantic hotel we have never seen in our trips. It is two stars but we thonk it worths four or five because: it is so precise in each particular of rooms, romantic design, excellen for a nest of love :D . It is so central, a couple of metro stations from moulin rouge or operà. It has a prive/quality level so high compared to other hotels. Finally people was so kind with us for each single request, you really feel to be @t home, your sweet home in Paris. Last, but not least, just in front there is a delicious japanese restaurant where we spent a lot of perfect oriental dinner perfectly in style with the New Oriental Hotel. I do believe to co e back again with my love.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elena R
Reviews.Content: + location, service, clean room - small room, poor breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel full of Parisian charm”
Reviews.Author: CymruSurferGirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for the first weekend in February 2012 ( 3rd - 5th) it was minus three in the day and snowed while we were there. The hotel was warm and cosy. The beds were so comfortable with spotless clean white sheets that we did not want to get up in the morning. Every time we entered the room it smelt fresh and clean. The bathroom was a good size with a shower over the bath, toilet and bidet.The shower was powerful and hot just what was needed after a days sightseeing! I loved the furniture, beautiful pieces that really gave the place warmth and character. We were on the fifth floor and loved the balcony and the view although due to the temperature we didn't make too much use of it. Although we didn't eat at the hotel the dining room reminded me of an elegant tea room. Our friends stayed in a hotel a few streets away and our room was much larger than any of theirs and a good size by Parisian standards. The staff we perfect; helpful, polite and friendly. When it came to the much discussed lift and stairs, if you have small children and therefore pushchairs etc, or are disabled potentially it could cause a problem. The lift is small and is at the top of the first section of spiralling stairs. However I noted pushchairs stored downstairs where we left out luggage when we checked out and the staff were so helpful I'm sure they would do what they can to accommodate you. I also did not notice the hotel being particularly noisy and I live in a rural area with little noise overnight so I do tend to notice that. I would recommend this hotel and fully intend to stay there whenever I go back. If you are looking for slick and modern don't bother, but if you want character and charm at a good price this is the hotel. As far as access to restaurants and sights etc, we actually walked to the Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coeur, Notre Dame Sunday markets etc, and made all sorts of discoveries along the way. There are several restaurants under a five minute walk away and three metro stations ( Villers, Rome, Europe) very close by so it's very easy to get about. In summary I cannot fault this hotel it was a pleasure to return to at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and nice location- just outside of the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: MJLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Located maybe about 1/4 mile from a underground train stop, it is actually a really nice location. My husband and i walked around and had NO problems at any time of nice. There is a laundromat right across the street so we were able to wash our clothes. The people at the front desk were very kind and were able to speak enough english that there was no problem communicating. Our room was really pretty, clean and nice. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: julie H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very quiet neighborhood, within walking distance to at least 2 metro stations. It is located a bit outside of the center of the city - is about a 15 minute walk to the Opera/Galeries Lafayette/Printemps area, for example, but this wasn't a problem for me, as I don't mind walking. I was staying in a single room, which is quite compact, but plenty of space for one person. The wifi connection was good throughout my 2 day stay. The room and bathroom were very clean, and the staff were all very pleasant and helpful. When I'm back in Paris, I will definitely be looking into staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “30th Birthday treat - And a treat is was!”
Reviews.Author: Wilkdz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year back in March, but have only just got round to reviewing! The hotel is located in a quite neighbourhood with some very nice restaurants around, it is also very close to a number of Metro stations, so you are never to far from the action, although most days we chose to walk from the hotel to the tourist spots, it is a walk but definitely can be done. The hotel itself is tiny, but has the feel of a big 5 star hotel with it's well appointed rooms and immaculate design. Yes the rooms are very small, but that did not bother us, it had a bed and a bathroom and that is all we needed. When we went the hotel was undergoing a renovation but this did not disrupt our stay at all, so all credit to the owners here. The one thing I would say is that the lift if extremely old, tired and tiny, my partner used the lift on arrival but this did not leave room for our bags, which meant I did the galliant thing and lugged them up the stairs, also getting out of the lift can be a little tricky as it opens directly onto some stairs! This is more down to a lack of space than anything else. We tried a B&B on a more recent visit to Paris, but both agreed that next time we return we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendliest staff I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Saywabish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend break to Paris. The hotel is easy to get to from the Eurostar station although there is a bit of a walk up a hill from st lazare. Before you even go through the door you can tell the hotel is going to be good! It's on a quiet street with a few little restaurants, bakery's and other hotels around it. We didn't have any problems with noise although it did take a while to get used to the rumble of the underground... Maybe take earplugs if you're not used to being in a city. The room was small but did the job, the shower was so nice you didn't want to get out of it! There's a safe provided which puts your mind at ease. The highlight of the hotel for us though was just how friendly the staff are, they speak good English and are happy to help with anything. One evening after we went for dinner we asked for a pot of tea which they were happy to provide, one downside may be that hot drinks aren't provided in the room but they're willing to make you one at any time so its not a problem. We think the room was really good value for money and we will be going back again as well as recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless rooms and great staff”
Reviews.Author: rosscoe7999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the New Orient for a week in January. The hotel is bright, welcoming and spotlessly clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly...my bag had been delayed and they were very helpful in making sure it was delivered to me. I stayed by myself so I had a single room which was perhaps the smallest room I have ever stayed in (and I've stayed in dozens of European hotels so I know they're different than American ones). The shower was so small i couldn't bend over to shave my legs withoug spilling water onto the fllor and it was located very awkwardly near the toilet. I didn't have any problems getting in and out, but someone older or larger than me could have had a real problem, almost to the point of being hazardous. That being said, I was there for business not pleasure, so my needs were a little bit different. In any case, I would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay again, but I would pay extra to have a double room in hopes of having a bit more space. The room I was in was very bright and cheerful and though it was tiny, it was very nice...plus the bed was super comfortable. For the price, it cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and elegant.”
Reviews.Author: maudrey m
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in december. We liked the fact that the hotel, nicely decorated, was well situated in the center of Paris.Our room was nice and cosy. Staff was pretty helpfull also. We do recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, comfortable and super helpful”
Reviews.Author: Enaksekali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Orient Hotel in December, shortly before Christmas. After a long flight, the elegant and festively decorated lobby was a delight as was the helpfulness of the staff and the warmth and privacy of the room, tucked in a quiet corner of the hotel, overlooking a quintessentially Parisian courtyard. The hotel is perfect for independent travellers who want comfort, good value for money and a little part of Paris that is still very local, yet a stone's throw from all the well known landmarks of the city. Thank you for a lovely stay and we would certainly choose to return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant llittle gem!”
Reviews.Author: C L
Reviews.Content: We only spent 1 night at the New orient Hotel but could not have been more impressed. The staff were amazing, very helpful and went the extra mile! The hotel itself is very cute and full of charm! Well done to all the staff and we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: AntonyS9
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over the new year period and found it to be a great base for getting to all the major sites across Paris. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, with some hints and tips. Decent sized rooms ( for Paris), rooms cleaned daily ( even on new year's day) and smartly decorated. A great choice for anyone not wishing to pay over the odds or stay in a international characterless hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely cute hotel in a fantastic location with superb service”
Reviews.Author: Peter T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early January 2012 and we blown away by the cute look of the hotel coupled with lovely cosy rooms and a new, extremely clean bathroom. We were pleasantly surprised to find a traditional french balcony with a little table and chairs which we were able to enjoy due to the unseasonably mild weather. There was also a TV, a safe and free Wi-Fi. On our arrival we were greeted warmly and instantly made to feel welcome (very much unlike your standard 4-star branded hotel). We were able to get useful information about the surrounding area and also the best ways to get around. We ended up walking through Paris for the majority of our trip. Notre Dame was the furthest away and took approx 45mins but the walk allowed us to take in other sights like Madeline and the Opera. Moulin Rouge, Galeries Lafayette and the Arch de Triomphe are a 10 mins walk away (in their respective directions). This is the first hotel I have been minded to review as it helped to make our stay in Paris for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nate C
Reviews.Content: My GF and I decided to visit Paris to celebrate the New Year. We decided to stay at New Orient due to it's close vicinity to the metro. The neighborhood was great with a ton of small cafes near the Villiers stop. The staff was incredibly helpful is reserving us spots at local restaurants as well as finding things to do during the extended New Year holiday. I would highly recommend this place and would stay there again upon my return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: johnsterlingbucks
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 very pleasant days in Paris staying at the New Orient. Like so many others, we found this hotel to be excellent and a very good base for getting around the city. It is spotlessly clean, recently refurbished, all the staff are extremely friendly and helpful and do all they can to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Our room was a decent sized double, tastefully decorated, with a separate shower and toilet . We had all our breakfasts at the Hotel and at 12 euros, the full buffet breakfast was good value, with plenty of choice and served in a delightful breakfast room. There are many cafes, restaurants,bakeries and small stores close at hand and with 3 Metro stations within easy walking distance, plus buses and RER at Gare St. Lazare, getting to any of the major tourist destinations was easy. We actually had no difficulty walking to Sacre Couer/ Montmartre or BoulevardeHousseman and Notre Dame and you see all the things you miss on the Metro. The Saturday organic market around the corner is well worth seeing, as is the lovely Parc Monceau. Another good walk was through the Parc and down Ave. Hoche to the Arc de Triomphe. We found the Bateaux Mouche Dinner Cruise was a lovely way to see Paris by night. The food was good and there was Champagne, Wine and Live Music all included. Having been to Paris several times before, this was our first visit to The New Orient, but we will definitely be going back again. If you're looking for somewhere very clean, comfortable, in a nice quiet suburb and with that lovely 'personal touch', then the New Orient ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeM397
Reviews.Content: The New Orient is a great hotel. The rooms are clean and kept very well. The staff was attentive to all our needs during our stay, and the neighborhood has a great little bakery and convenience store. The staff had great recommendations for dining as well. After a long day strolling through Paris, the New Orient made us feel like we were coming home. The hotel itself is a bit removed from the popular attractions in Paris, but staying in a true Parisian neighborhood did have its benefits, such as being removed from the tourists during part of our stay. It is quite a walk to the Louvre, Eiffel Tower and other parts of the city, but it is manageable. Overall, this is a great hotel. The price is perfect and the rooms are perfect for couples. The staff made our stay pleasant. We arrived early on our first day, and they managed to get our room ready for us nearly three hours early so we could get in and relax after a long flight from the states! Overall, the New Orient is a great value with clean rooms and attentive staff. Their service should be a model to other hotels. The only downside to the hotel was its location - a little more than a 20 minute walk to the tourist destinations in Paris. But, for the price and level of service, we felt it was a good trade-off.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: onetreehill8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and found the staff to be very helpful at all times. Location was good, convenience store directly across to road, restaurants 5-10m walk. Room was small but clean. 15 Euro Taxi to the Eiffel Tower and 20 Euros to the Louvre. Breakfast wasn't included in our rate so we found a few different bakeries within 5 min walk, which were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but bellow the expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ole G
Reviews.Content: We was searching for a nice quite hotel, where we could celebrate new years eve. We read a lot of reviews and based on them we deceided to take lower class but ninec hotel, then higher and to tho cosy (from photos hotel looked very cozy). When we arived we were disapointed what we saw there, less then ordinary hotel and decoration of our room. Noise isolation of windows was good, but you could hear you naibours speaking or maids opening room doors. Service was realy nice and pleasant, location is also good, yo ucan reach all faumost places by foot in 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Beautiful Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: JoeyWeiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and did not want to leave this place. We loved our stay. Coming back every night to this hotel was such a relief - nice cozy room. A short walk to the nearest metro (5 minutes), Villiers. Supermarket just in front of the hotel, extremely convenient. Close to excellent market street, rue de levis. Plenty of good bakeries around. One morning, we opened the window and stayed in the balcony eating baguette and cheese for breakfast. Feel like Parisians. Memorable. Most important to us is our room, oh so quaint so homey. Comfortable bed and great bathroom. We slept well through out. Yes yes we noted that very few people are not happy with the stairs, the issue is that you need to climb 5 steps of stairs to get to the elevator but this is really no problem at all - it was a very short climb really. When we arrived our room was not ready yet, it was pretty early morning, so we left our luggages there, when we came back to check whether the room is ready, our luggages were already sent to the room, so thoughtful. Catherine (owner of New Orient - i assume), thank you for helping us to get a taxi in the morning and thank you for standing up for us from a taxi squabble (group of ladies who assumed the taxi was theirs but actually it was ours). This is what we call a great customer service, something that we would remember for a longtime. WE WILL COME BACK ANYTIME SOON... this is definitely a must stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best we've experienced in Paris. It's great value for money. The rooms we had (1 double, 2 twins and 1 single) were all newly decorated and very prettily done up, each different. Some had balconies. Alll the rooms were quiet. The service was very friendly and breakfast delicious with fresh home-baked bread in a pleasant front room (makes a change from the usual basement breakfast rooms). Very convenient for walking to THe Grand Palais, the rue du Faubourg St Honoré, Musée Jacquemart André...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Geoffw6
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading previous good reviews and the hotel and services lived up to our expectations. We stayed for 4 nights. Arrived late after our flight from Liverpool to Charles De Gaulle airport, took the RER from airport terminal to Gare de Nord and the metro to the nearby Villiers metro stop. We had room 24 on the 5th floor, which faced the street. The room was great, and the bed very comfy. The ensuite had a great shower. We came back each day to clean towels and the room made up. We had breakfast on one day only and for 12 euros we thought it was very good value for money. The reception staff were always very helpful with directions and ideas. This hotel is in our opinion excellent value for money and we really enjoyed our stay, its in a mainly residential area, but 5 minutes walk to Villiers metro which we used on a daily basis. There is also some good restaurants nearby, we had an excellent meal in Risi Bisi on Rue De Rocher, Its a small but intimate Italian restaurant and is excellently priced. Also nearby is a small boulangerie where we had breakfast on 3 mornings. and directly across the road a small supermarket for those everyday essentials which stays open till 9pm daily. We have visited Paris a couple of times and it is one of our favorite European cities, we know are way round fairly well, and if and when we return we would definitely choose The New Orient.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: DougandKatya
Reviews.Content: This place made our trip!!! We started at another hotel which was disgusting and called the new orient to find there was a room available. When we arrived we found that the hotel was perfect for a short stay. The rooms are stylist (a little small but perfect for a short stay), clean and the staff amazing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The location was great, the hotel perfect and the staff really made the stay a pleasure. A diamond in amongst thousands of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best pad after long tiring day in city of love.”
Reviews.Author: jazzmate
Reviews.Content: Staying for 3 nites based on review on Tripadvisor, I have no regrets choosing New Orient. Received by a nice English speaking lady, the start of this family holiday looks promising. A bit far of from usual touristy place, New Orient is very comfortable. Family room was a bit small but ok for Paris standard. Small lift only fit 2 adults and one young child. Luggages were sent by reception later. Even on check out they help me with luggages. They even allowed me to leave luggages when I continue my Europe tour for 6 days. My window were not able to close and they could only change the fender the next day. I leave the window open in the morning assuming the cleaners would lock it during room cleaning after went out to town he/she didn't. Had to 'lock' the window by putting the luggages that nite but no big deal. A supermarket and laundrette just opposite side of the road. Wifi is free throughout the hotel. While waiting for laundry, even managed to use lobby computer. It's that close. Overall very good stay at New Orient Paris. Name doesn't show the Frenchness though.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Linanna86
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel, primarily because of reading the reviews on tripadvisor. The staff were all very friendly and all the receptionists spoke English. I was made very welcome and stayed for 5 nights. The room was small but very comfortable and I slept very well. The shower/wc was very small but was always well maintained and clean. The lift was quite tiny, only accommodating 3 people but the hotel owner took my luggage up to my room on first arrival. The hotel is well situated being a 5 minute walk from Europe Metro station or about 10 minutes walk from Gare St Lazaire. It is situated in an area with lots of shops selling musical instruments and sheet music.

Reviews.Title: “Really charming and great value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nina99Sydney
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night but found this a very friendly and charming hotel. The area is very charming and attractive and convenient to the metro. There is a patisserie just up the road and there is a convenience store opposite. Very comfortable beds and small but adequate bathrooms. The free Internet is a bonus for an already well priced hotel. I had a room on the sixth level with a really charming tiny balcony overlooking beautiful buildings opposite. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JacWong
Reviews.Content: The owner Catherine and Joseph are very friendly and nice. You can tell under their management, the hotel is very well maintained. They try every ways to make the stay of their guests a pleasant one. Stayed there two nights for the second half of my journey. Am glad with my choice as the hotel location is perfect - few minutes to metro, 10 minutes to a streets full of highly rated restaurants, 15 minutes by walk to Printemps and Lafayette. The bed is so compfortable that I thought the bed linen is brand new! Bath room is so clean that it looks like it has recently refurbished. Free wifi provided which allowed me to search for restaurants and travel tips without any cost concern. Only drawback is the lift as you have to be careful not to make a big step when come out of the lift. But once you get used to it, it is no big deal. Its good value of money and a pleasant stay in New Orient. Catherine and Joseph, hope you enjoyed your time in HK and Bali!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris, last time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shari610
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world, and not saying that to brag but to say I stay in many hotels and have experienced many times of places. I have never experienced a two star before, but live by trip advisor, and this one came highly recommended. We are celebrating a special occasion and it is Christmas and we will be back for new years as well. Being disabled I explained my situation. Well, when we checked in, we did get a room, ( was told it was the best) really scared scared to see what the worst looks like. It is the size of my closet. Noisy, can't walk on stairs and I wear a size six shoe. My husband is 6'1 and his feet hang off bed, it is supposed to be soundproof rooms, that's why we were woken up at 3:30 am, but some fighting French couple. When I explained I was so disappointed , the man at desk said owners were away and that is just how it was, no refunds. We are paid up for 3 more days when we return after the wine region later in the week. If he does not return my money I will keep writing bad reviews, talk to owners, and call better business bureau.. My back is killing me, these beds are horrible if you have any sort of back issues and are taller than 5' 7. People always talk about money and savings, but today we went to the eiffel tower, a place many will never get to experience in their life time and I was miserable. It sucked. All I can say is, I am very angry and sad that he was so rude and not even caring about my pain or ruining my special occasion. However, today is Christmas, and though it cost me a few more dollars, life is short and priceless and we just go around once... So oui oui

Reviews.Title: “great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sarahpR957
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location for touring Paris. Terrific bathroom, with separate shower. have received in great polite front desk We had to change rooms due to noise issues (not traffic)good for visting the area.Nice breakfast service 20 Euros per day for Internet connection was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Paris with my 82 year old Mother”
Reviews.Author: 54Anshe54
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel, but it was a little far to the main sight seeing area's. There were buses and trains near bye but it would of been better to be in the heart are the actions. There was a lot of great restaurants near the hotel. The hotel price was great but the breakfast was a little expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cheap stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Charlie C
Reviews.Content: For value of money this place can't be beaten in Paris. Lovely staff and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Vickiedo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and the staff are incredibly helpful. The service we received was personal and everyone took great care to ensure we had everything we needed. Whilst the room we had was small (to be expected with Parisian hotels) we had everything we needed and it felt very homely. It was nice to stay in an independent hotel that none of the impersonal touches of a large chain. I can't understand why it's only a 2 star. I'll definitely stay again and recommend it to others,

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay, great memories!”
Reviews.Author: emandj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while exploring the museums in Paris. The hotel was really easy to find, pretty conveniently located near Montmartre and 3 metro stops. This place definitely has more of a B&B feel to it, but they have a 24-hour front desk. The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations for food & drink. Our room was very nice & cozy - the stairwell was TINY & very steep, but luckily they had a little elevator. We didn't spend much time in the room, honestly, but we slept fine and I enjoyed the view of the busy street below. The decor was "classic", I'd say. They had free wifi in the hotel which was pretty good. We didn't eat breakfast there, but there are several good bakeries close by.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster!”
Reviews.Author: Cave_latte
Reviews.Content: I made my booking for this hotel about 1 month before my trip, and I received a confirmation email shortly after that. However, to my shock a few days before the trip, I received another email informing me that my room booking was cancelled! When I produce the confirmation email, I was ignored... I was so disappointed and upset at the reliability and service I received from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the Best hotels of 2; that I would recommend! The staff goes the next nth for you!”
Reviews.Author: JacquieDu
Reviews.Content: I had a single room. I stayed at three hotels during my trip to Paris and Amsterdam. The New Orient was by far the best on several levels! Most importantly is their staff and location! Second (?) the hotel is aa beautiful little jewel. The elevator is small, but useable. I Really wished my husband could have been with me because the double rooms where excellent on the rue Constantinople side with the antiques, but modern bathrooms! I will return, I promise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CMC2011_06
Reviews.Content: Little bit out of the way - but amazing value for money. Spotless room, fantastic service by the team on reception, and overall just great.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: squeakybones
Reviews.Content: We are very happy we chose this hotel. Though it is a bit out of the way, it's close to several Metro stops. It was very clean and had the most comfortable beds of our whole trip. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Even though our window faced the busy street, it was perfectly quiet when the window was closed. The room was small, but charming. Breakfast was fine. We decided to extend our stay in Paris and were disappointed when we found out they were fully booked. But we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: PKMaceo
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through previous recommendations on TripAdvisor....and they were spot on. The staff are extremely helpful and courteous. Ask for any type of recommendation & you'll get lots of ideas/suggestions. The rooms are on the small side (typical of Paris) but nicely decorated and well maintained. The location is nice; off the main street but still only a couple of blocks from the metro and cafes & shops. There's a grocery store across the street and a patisserie a few doors down....very convenient. You really can't go wrong with this hotel for your trip to Paris!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: isabellaparis1
Reviews.Content: the location ok, but a little remote for me. the room was small, which was ok, but the walls were paper thin. i could hear the people in the rooms beside and above me in the bathroom - every sound. when they were talking in the room beside me, it was if they were sitting in my room, and they were not loud - just conversational. the elevator is tiny and you have to climb a flight of narrow rickety stairs to get to it. it is overpriced for what it is. i would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better experience than some other 3 or 4 start hotels we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: hkhhouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early November after staying at a 2 star Disney Paris hotel. The experience was so much better and even better than some higher start hotels we have stayed at in the past. It is a very small hotel, but the charm and genuine staff make up for any lacking amenities. We never tried eating breakfast there because we wanted to eat on the streets of Paris as much as possible. Just down the street, there is a wonderful bakery. Directly across the street from the hotel, there is a small market, where we bought snacks and water. We were in room 2, which had a shower and bath. Yes, it is small but we only needed it for our young son. We found the room to be a little small but just fine for the 3 of us. We had 3 medium size suit cases and were fine with the space. We found the beds to be very comfortable. As already mentioned by others, 2 metro stations (Metro and Villiers) are very close by, about a couple blocks away. We found a street near the Villiers station to be full of life in the morning with all the bakeries, produce markets and butcher shops open. We came back at night to find that the restaurants are not on that same street but also nearby. We took the TGV train from the airport to Disneyland Paris upon arrival. It was easy to manage our luggage and toddler. We even managed to get from Disneyland Paris to New Orient by train and metro. However, we were didn't think it would be so easy to go back to the airport from Paris via metro, especially since we would be going during rush hour. Catherine helped us order a taxi, and we got there without any troubles. It cost about 55 euros plus tip. We think that it wouldn't have been that much less if we took the metro for the 3 of us. We would definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hosts, great location, excellent B&B”
Reviews.Author: Steljon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 9 Days in Paris at the beginning of November and we were absolutely delighted that we chose to stay at the New Orient. The location is perfect - quiet but very accessible to all those parts of Paris that first time visitors want to see and the hospitality is simply first class. Catherine, Joseph and their staff were so friendly and helpful that we almost felt like we were at home. We asked for a quiet room and were accommodated in a charming rear room on the 5th floor that was easily accessible by lift. Staff took care of our bags to and from the room and each morning our room was serviced during the time we were at breakfast. It was very quiet, cosy and provided all the amenties we needed. A limited buffet breakfast cost an extra 12 Euro per person and it was a great way to start the day. We were provided with maps to guide us around Paris and given directions to train and bus stations, restaurants and places of interest. Would particularly recommend a restaurant called Bistro du 17eme located about a 15 minute walk away. For a set price of 42 Euro per person you get a glass of bubbles to start, tantalising choices of 3 courses and a bottle of wine per 2 diners. Be sure to have Catherine or Joseph book for you. We can only reiterate all of the great comments that have been recorded previously on Tripadvisor and thoroughly recommend New Orient to the budget conscious visitor who likes special treatment.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best things about Paris!”
Reviews.Author: AnnapolisMatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our London and Paris vacation back in August. This place was amazing. Let's be honest, Paris in August is amazing with all of the locals being on holiday, it was deserted. What stands out about this place. First and foremost, the staff was incredible and friendly. The were always attentive to our needs and willing to help us out. Further, we had an unfortunate incident of wine spilling on the sheets (to which we were both horrified) and the staff didn't make a fuss about it and had them cleaned; and we weren't charged. Location: It is located in the 8th district which is nice as its not touristy and well priced. It is convientiently located close to the subway station, about a brisk 20 minute walk to the Arc and about a 45 minute walk to the Louvre. There is a little market street about 2-3 blocks down the street where you can grab any fresh pastries or other sundries. There is a grocery store directly across the street, which is very helpful if you are eating on the run. If you are into walking a lot (which we are) this is a great place and location to stay. Rooms: While not big rooms, I didn't mind the size. They are about the standard size of a 2nd or 3rd bedroom in your typical American single family home. The bathrooms were recently updated and had all new fixtures. Our room had a balcony with a view of the street and flowers on the window sil. The hotel offers a breakfast for about 8 Euros a person that is comprised of pastries and coffee, sufficient for a quick bite. Overall, this place was just what we expected and most of the reviews accurately reflect the awesomeness of this place. I would recommend this place to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do they really have only 2 stars?”
Reviews.Author: chantimi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my trip to Paris after reading so many good comments here. And I am happy I chose this hotel. To me the location was very important as my main purpose of going to Paris is buying things from special stores in Paris and I could not be so far away from Metro and the city. This hotel was just 2 Metro stations away from Opera and it was a very short trip (by taxi) from Arc de Triomphe after I got off the airport bus from Orly. My room was small but the bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The staff was all friendly and they smiled when I came back to the hotel after a long day of signtseeing and meetings. I will stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “3 nights at the New Orient Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: millerfamily5
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife in a double room with balcony overlooking the Rue de Constantinople a short walk from the nearest metro Villiers. We booked late and this was the only room left for our stay from 23 Oct 2011. I made the choice following advice from Trip Advisor and what a great choice it was. The Hotel was spotless, the room (22) on the 5th floor, was a perfect size quite large with a lovely old wardrobe with hanging space, large mirror, drawers and shelves, ensuite bathrooms with over bath shower, the bed was large and also very comfortable. Watch out when opening the lift door opening over the stairs half way between floors in case someone is passing on the stairs. Lovely views from the balcony, where we had a table and chairs, and enjoyed the evening with a bottle of wine from the supermarket opposite. Lovely to return to after a tiring day of walking around the city, and such a beautiful city too. No night time noise from the street below. Nice continental breakfast with fresh orange juice, fresh rolls, croissants, jams and lovely coffee. The staff were so friendly despite my poor attempts to speak French. At my email request the Hotel pre booked a restaurant of my choice before we arrived for the Sunday night of our arrival and confirmed the booking by email. When we eventually got to the hotel late after a lengthy RER train and metro ride (next time I'm getting a taxi despite the expense) the hotel staff booked a taxi for us to take us to the restaurant 7eme Vin (which was great). As our flight wasn't till late on the 4th day the Hotel brought our suitcase down and allowed us to leave it all day. Definitely a Hotel that’s worth the price of the rooms. Definitely a Hotel to return to. We loved our stay at the New Orient.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Value; Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: KellyMiller14420
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last three nights of our two week vacation at the delightful New Orient Hotel. It is situated in a safe neighborhood in the 8th Arrondissement with excellent access to the metro, a local market, numerous restaurants, a boulangerie and a patisserie. The Paris Conservatory of Music is also located nearby, providing an interesting and eclectic mix of shops catering to music students. Like other reviewers we found our room to be a bit small but very comfortable. The decor was inviting mixture of contemporary and traditional styles. The bathroom was larger than expected and well appointed. Everything worked great including the water pressure and temperature controls. A small balcony was accessible through a pair of french doors and was furnished with a small table, two chairs, and a big flower box overflowing with bright red gardenias. It was fun to sit and watch Parisians go about their daily lives while sipping wine and enjoying a macaron or a nice frommage. The walls are typical of older construction, i.e. lacking sound-proofing, but the management has thoughtfully limited the volume control on the television. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The room was clean and the maid staff keep it that way for the duration of our stay. The reception staff were attentive and professional. The one curiosity was the elevator providing service to landings in-between floors. This was not an issue because the reception staff insisted on delivering our luggage to our room, and retrieving it at the end of our stay. Overall, this proved to be a great experience and an outstanding value! I highly recommend the New Orient Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian gem!”
Reviews.Author: teamhdisgo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the New Orient Hotel! The staff was charming and very welcoming. They made us feel at home from the moment we walked in. We were delighted by the room. It was small (by American standards) but clean, comfortable, and outfitted with lovely antiques. The view from the window was beautiful! The breakfast was delicious. The location was great, near two Metro lines and just a short walk away from Gare St. Lazare. What else is there to say except you should stay here when you go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Un petit bijou”
Reviews.Author: kensmoon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a one week stay in this excellent hotel in July this year. Staff were welcoming, helpful and patient when practising your French! Had a few conversations with Amar, who was particularly engaging, offering snippets of information about the local area. All members of the team were quick with a smile, wishing you a good day when you left and greeting you on your return. The room was compact but very comfortable, tastefully furnished and decorated to a good standard. Curtains and bedspreads had a quality feel and were nicely designed with paintings adding to the splash of colour. We thought the cushions on the rail above the beds were a practical and novel touch. The toilet and shower were clean with plenty of hot water. Breakfast was good; fruit juice, cheese, ham, rolls, preserves, cereals and superb coffee, served up in an elegant, cool touch silver coffee pot. Vera was a ray of sunshine in the morning, showing a good sense of humour as I continued trying out my limited French! Location was ideal, with Parc Monceau a short stroll away, beautifully planted and popular with joggers on Sundays. There is a well stocked minimarket opposite the hotel, offering a decent variety of items and good value for money (Corbieres for 1 euro 60, ideal for picnics!), a boulangerie nearby and an unassuming bar and brasserie called A L'Esperance, frequented by locals and handy for breakfast such as omelette, espressos etc. We would recommend Pizza Scus'y, 89 rue du Rocher, for a delicious Italian meal, sensible prices, vegans and vegetarians catered for, and a singing chef! Thanks to the whole team, from housekeepers right up to the owners for ensuring a comfortable and pleasant stay with an extra helping of French hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Paris hotel. Very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: hollylexinejade
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with friendly english-speaking staff and great coffees after long and tiring couple of flights. We had a small but cosy room with a cute little balcony. Loved the decor of the hotel, ideal for those who want are looking to stay in a typical Parisian apartment. Great location with several metro stations nearby. Very satisfied couple of customers, and will stay here again next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: rayraynewby
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel, primarily because of reading the reviews on tripadvisor. The staff were all very friendly and all the receptionists spoke English. I was made very welcome and stayed for 5 nights. The room was small but very comfortable and I slept very well. The shower/wc was very small but was always well maintained and clean. The lift was quite tiny, only accommodating 3 people but the hotel owner took my luggage up to my room on first arrival. The hotel is well situated being a 5 minute walk from Europe Metro station or about 10 minutes walk from Gare St Lazaire. It is situated in an area with lots of shops selling musical instruments and sheet music.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bliss-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in October. It was the best nights sleep I had in weeks. I had a single bedroom to the back of the building. Yes, it was small but extremely comfortable, clean and cozy. The bed was perfect and it was very quiet. I liked the decor. Reception spoke English and was really very helpful, patient and friendly. I didn't think I would have breakfast in the hotel but I did and I enjoyed it very much. l used the laundromat on the other side of the street, very convenient. I traveled through Europe by myself for 2 weeks and this was my favorite place. It's in a great location, I walked everywhere. I work for a world class, five star resort in the USA and tend to be quite picky. I'm looking forward to visiting this charming hotel with my husband in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: purplenoodle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Feb 2011 for my birthday and this was my first trip to Paris. The hotel is conventionally located near several metro stations and in a quiet area with a delightful local market. The hotel is simply delightful, if on the small side. The room was comfortable, chic and clean. The staff were attentive, polite and helpful. It totally fulfilled my expectations of a bijou Parisian boutique hotel and I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in the midst of it all”
Reviews.Author: girl_from_vancity
Reviews.Content: I spent the last few nights of my most recent trip to France at the New Orient and selected it based on Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel met all of my expectations. It’s in a very convenient part of Paris for visiting some of the major attractions, and is near three Metro stations making it easy to get around the rest of the city. Our twin room (#17) was cosy but still had an airy feeling, thanks to the big window. The beds were really comfortable, and room was clean and nicely kept. The breakfast room was really nice, and with the basic 8 euro breakfast you get a selection of Viennoiseries, fresh orange juice, and coffee, tea, cappuccino or hot chocolate. The staff was very helpful, and were kind enough to loan us a corkscrew and wine glasses one evening when we were enjoying a little apero. For the price, you couldn’t ask for a better location. Just a note - if you have trouble with winding stairs, this hotel may not be for you. There is an elevator that only stops between floors, so you have to walk up one flight of stairs to reach it, and then either up or down a flight of steps to reach your room. There's a sign on the elevator door warning to watch your step, and they mean it! The hotel staff will bring your luggage up and down for you, so no worries for those with heavy suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: NaRif2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to three or four metro stations, and only a few stops from L'Arc de Triomphe, so is in an idea location to see the sights of Paris. It is in a safe area too (we were wondering around at 2300 and felt safe). There are restaurants too within 5-10 minutes walk of the hotel, as well as a boulangerie and patisserie for breakfast. We had a double room, the bed was nice and the room was clean. The bathroom had a shower and toilet, and was large enough for a hotel of that standard (and both worked really well). We woukd definately stay there again and recommend it to others....the only two things to note are that the walls are a bit thin so you can hear some noise from the adjoining rooms. The other thing is that the lift does not service the floors properly. It is on a 'mezzanine' between each floor, so at worst you will have to take your luggage up/down half a flight of stairs regardless of what floor you're staying on. This is a bit annoying with heavy suitcases!! Otherwise this is a great little hotel to stay in and to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “" We were amazed "”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Orient Hotel in September this year. Being our 1st time in Paris we were unsure what to expect and where to stay. The New Orient Hotel was everything people had said it was on Trip Advisor. On arrival we were met by very friendly reception staff. Nothing was a problem for them. Our room was excellent we had a room with a little balcony facing the street, it was quiet and extremely clean. The location is excellent and within easy walking distance to main attractions. We were fortunate enough to meet the owners who recommended some of the local restaurants which all served fine food. We have recommended the Hotel to other travellers & friends as it is value for money. If we ever travel to Paris again we would definately stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tyler K
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the New Orient Hotel and found the location very helpful to the metro and other sites. My small room did have a nice size bathroom and I loved the balcony that provided a lovely view. The breakfast, I thought, was over-priced and the stairs and entry to the elevator are truly treacherous. One of the desk clerks was very helpful and friendly, another could not be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: diegodogCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Orient Hotel for 3 nights recently and had chosen this place based on Trip Advisor reviews. As we had requested when we booked several months ago, we were given an upper floor room with a little balcony overlooking the street. The room is on the small side but still large enough even with 3 suitcases. I have only two somewhat negative observations to make and these concerns are not serious. First, while there is an elevator to help in getting bags to the room, some care is still needed as the elevator stops a few steps down on the spiral stairway. Still, if we managed fine, other folks should be able to manage as well. Second, and this is very subjective, the hair dryer is of the built-in type, rather than a more powerful plug-in variety. But these small criticisms are far outweighed by the advantages. The staff were friendly, giving us advice for dining, using the best metro routes, and rental car drop-off discussion. (For those who may be thinking of doing what we did, dropping a car off at the Rue de Barri location and using the drop-box, the car is to be left in the underground Vinci parkade at the end of Rue de Barri, the drop-box is at the corner of one of booths down there; the security guard helped us out.) We enjoyed this hotel's location very much. It felt like a real neighbourhood, and the last night we were there as we sat on the little balcony finishing off our wine and cheese, we watched the residents across the way as they enjoyed their balconies as well. We recommend this hotel for those wanting good value and a more personable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Perfect as PARIS!!!”
Reviews.Author: rvesule
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at New Orient hotel on July 2011 with my wife. We are brazilians and this was our first time in Paris. The New Orient hotel is charming and perfect as Paris. The staff is very friendly, speak multiple languages, the rooms are extremely clean and charming. We couldn't ask nothing better than New Orient Hotel for our first stay in Paris. If we could describe the hotel in a word is: Perfect. Good price, good location, near good restaurants, in front of a small market, near a train station, near Blv. Haussmann, Opera, and Lafayette Galleries. We recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: bostondemo
Reviews.Content: We called the New Orient from the USA to place our reservation. They immediately e-mailed us a printed confirmation with the details of our stay. Upon arrival, they were very pleasant and accommodating. They provided a secure place to keep our luggage, and our luggage was waiting in our room when we returned. Our room was very comfortable, clean and affordable. The bed was also very comfortable! The location was wonderful because it was within walking distance to anywhere we cared to go. The Managers, Catherine and Josef Wehrle and staff spoke English and were very helpful with directions and advice. Needless to say, for all these reasons we highly recommend this hotel. But our recommendation goes deeper. While walking around Paris, we noticed many people with their baggage in tow. We started chatting with one such couple who had asked us for directions. They had made and provided their credit card for 4 evenings in a Paris hotel 3 days prior to their arrival. The hotel didn’t have a phone number listed and although he had sent several e-mails attempting to confirm their reservation, he never got a confirmation. I’m bringing this up so you all benefit from these two points: 1) It is wise to call hotels directly rather than relying on the internet for confirmation. 2) Without a written confirmation of your room, some Paris hotels may actually re-book your room if they get a higher price from someone who is there in person. Most importantly, those two points allow me to elaborate on how the New Orient demonstrate high standards and how incredibly helpful they really are. We took the couple mentioned in the previous paragraph who were in search of a room back with us to the New Orient to see if perhaps they had a vacancy for that night. They did not. However, Catherine started making calls to hotels to help the couple find a room. This couple wasn’t staying there, and since the New Orient was full for the rest of the week, the New Orient had nothing to monetarily gain. Monetary gain wasn’t her motive. She is a kind hearted, good person who simply wanted to help. After about an hour of calling every hotel she knew, she called them a cab and gave the driver instructions to quickly take them to the official Tourist office to help them find a room for the evening. This type of service is what elevates the New Orient to an exception hotel. This level of service extended to the weekend staff as well. I specifically wrote down the name of the gentleman at the front desk who helped us so I could personally acknowledge him, but have unfortunately since lost my slip of paper. I thought his name was Michael, but the only male name I could find on the hotel website was Amar. I do apologize if I’ve acknowledge the wrong person, but I am confident that no matter who sits at that front desk, the exceptional service remains the same! We had hoped that there would be an additional cancellation to enable us to stay at the New Orient through Monday, but that was not in the cards. On Saturday, Amar took a great deal of time to go over hotel options available at and near the airport. Once we made our selection, he called the hotel, booked our room, printed out the e-mail confirmation and gave us written directions to keep us from getting lost. All this took well over an hour, and he stayed with it as if he were staying there himself! Definitely service above and beyond the call of duty!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - lovely quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeaSpringfield
Reviews.Content: My recent trip to Europe meant that I commenced and finished my holiday in Paris so I stayed at this hotel 4 nights at the start and 2 nights at the finish. This was my second trip to Paris and I decided to stay on the Louvre side. The hotel is situated closed to two train stations on different lines which added to the convience. I walked to Montmartre which was a pleasant stroll. I also walked to the Louvre and the Opera House. With a food market close to the hotel and with cafes and bakeries and even a convience store opposite it is very easy to buy basic items close to the hotel. The rooms were always clean and well decorated adding to the quaint atmosphere of the region. The rooms are small but that's Paris! The cost was reasonable for its proximity. Breakfast is available at two prices - generous continental or full breakfast. The food is lovely and fresh and the breakfast staff and pleasant and helpful. As a independent traveller the reception staff were always helpful and kind. My bags were delivered to my room. The hotel lift stops midfloor but the quaintness of the hotel has a warm atmosphere. I would stay there again and recommend the hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveYVR
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this place! It is probably the best value in Paris under 150 EUR. If you are on a budget, but want quintessential romantic parisian, stay here. Small rooms, but not cramped and tons of character, bathrooms are bigger than expected, internet is free, bed is great and clean!! Windows open onto the street with pretty flowers in the window boxes. No Air con. Breakfast is 8 or 12 EUR depending on what you want. The location is perfect, 2 blocks away from 2 metro lines, amazing restaurants on Rue de Dames and a block long street market. There is laundromat and dry cleaners across the street from the hotel. The staff were really helpful, polite and tried to be patient with us non french. They offered advice and maps. Great, great couples on a budget trip! Stayed 6 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our needs”
Reviews.Author: odys47
Reviews.Content: This was the first visit to Paris by my wife and myself and, after extensive research of hotels using Trip Advisor reviews, we chose to stay at the New Orient for our 6 nights in Paris. We were not disappointed. Our room was impeccably kept and just like the pictures on the website, including having a small balcony overlooking the street. Small but very tasteful. Catherine, Josef and their staff were most helpful during our stay, including loaning us at no cost an adaptor (so that we could charge up computer), arranging tea in our room each morning and also arranging a taxi for us to the airport (and a complimentary tea while we waited for it to arrive). The location of the hotel was very good. It is close to the main railway stations and to two Metro Stations, Villiers and Europe - which makes getting around very easy. Also, it is within comfortable walking distance of Montmartre and the other main sights such as the Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower and the Seine. Opposite the hotel there is a supermarket and a hundred yards further down the street towards the Villiers Metro station there is a wonderful patisserie. It is also reasonably close to several bistro restaurants. All in all we had an excellent time, and would happily recommend the New Orient Hotel to others. It is of extremely high quality for a hotel that only has two stars.

Reviews.Title: “We'll always have Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bodazzler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the New Orient for just over a week in July and we could not recommend it more highly. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, not to mention patient with our attempts at French and were always happy to accommodate our requests. The hotel is located close to a number of metro stations making our travels around the city a lot easier than the otherwise might have been. It is also slightly off the tourist trail which meant that we got to experience real Parisian living, including shopping at the local food markets just down the street. We look back on our time at the New Orient with very fond memories and we will definitely be booking a room with them again next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel - they make you feel like family”
Reviews.Author: sweptaway61
Reviews.Content: I travelled for the first time to Paris in May and had a lot of recommendations from friends about possible accommodation. I kept looking at Trip Advisor comments and decided to ignore well meant advice and book the New Orient. All of the reviews were correct. The staff here are outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble for them. There was a variety of staff on the front desk during our 5 day stay and they were all excellent. The room was small but frankly we were hardly ever there. They spoke very good English, helped with train schedules and recommended somewhere for my 50th birthday meal. Prices were reasonable and the place was spotless. We had to catch a very early taxi - they arranged a wake-up call and even made us a coffee while we waited for the taxi. What more can I say! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: kirsty00
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel for what you pay. Room is small but that is the case for most hotels in Europe. Well looked after and the staff are very nice and helpful unlike many other people in Paris. Location is very good. Five minutes to train station. Wouldn't stay here for a long time due to room size but if you are spending most of your time seing the sights it is very suitable due to location and friendly staff. Grocery store right across the road. If your looking for a very French hotel this will meet your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “New Orient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paxlulu
Reviews.Content: The staff at the New Orient Hotel were very friendly and helpful. There is a laundromat and grocery store across the street from this hotel. The main tourist attractions are a bit far to walk to from here but the metro is nearby to take you there. This neighbourhood in itself seems to be very lively. As for the room I stayed in, it was very clean but VERY tiny. No matter where I placed my luggage (I only had one suitcase) it would be in the way. Also, to get into the shower, one has to do a sideways shuffle past the toilet. Overall, I had a pleasent experience at this hotel but before booking here again I would check to see if there is a hotel more centrally located with a larger suite available for the same price range (98 Euros per night).

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Heraklia
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor highly rated this medium-expense hotel, and the location was new to me, so I tried it and loved it. Very European but utterly charming, with charming decor, everything squeaky clean, painted, and attractively decorated, and very helpful staff - even though my French is pretty awful, they politely mixed their responses in English and French. WiFi in all rooms and a full computer downstairs if you don't have your laptop handy. I adored the location.
