The metro is literally two blocks down the streets, both a dry cleaners and a clean laundromat across the street, neat cafes and lots of interesting and useful shops handy, and the lovely Parc Monceau just down the road. I had no trouble using the metro to get around Paris and the New Orient more than met my hopes, all for a very reasonable charge for Paris. Breakfast in the pretty little breakfast room, with sunlight streaming in the sparkling clean windows, is a great way to reacquaint yourself with cafe creme and croissants! I should also note, I had a back room and it was deliciously quiet and Rue Constantinople is peaceful after dark and felt safe to walk in, although (as always) it pays to be cautious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Connie C
Reviews.Content: My brother and I spent 4 nights at the New Orient Hotel the first week of Oct. 2011. The room was clean and comfortable even though it was a little small. The hotel was quiet and well maintained. Staff was helpful and very nice. The hotel was close to all types of transportation and it was very easy to get to all the museums and monuments. There also is an open air market just a couple of blocks away that had all kinds of bakeries, cafes, and shopping! We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynnekovan
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights on a short holiday. The location was perfect for us as we could access everything we needed. Although our room was quite small, it was very clean and comfortable. Would have been nice to have something to put things on, but everything else was good. The staff are all exceptionally friendly and helpful. There is a good selection of travel and other books available to borrow. We had the continental breakfast which wasn't great, and overpriced, but the salon we ate in was lovely. We would definitely recommend this little hotel, and we would come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little boutique hotel nestled in quiet district”
Reviews.Author: Duncan6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the New Orient for 4 nights in September and absolutely loved the hotel and the staff. Yes the rooms are small but this is Paris. It is a classic boutique hotel you would expect to find in Paris. Exactly what we wanted. Our room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable and we had a wonderful balcony with a little patio table and chairs to enjoy our wine in the evenings. The location was excellent, as it's only a 2 minute walk to the Metro. The instructions we were given to get to the hotel from the train station were perfect and we had no problems finding it using the metro. The service was professional and friendly. They even gave us a lovely anniversary card and gift. The morning we left the night desk agent woke up at 4 am to make us coffee to get us started on our early morning flight. Now that's service above and beyond (and was greatly appreciated). I wouldn't hestitate to recommend this hotel. The recommendations they gave us for restaurants were excellent and there is a bakery, laundromat and a wonderful street a few minutes away where all the locals do their shopping. Lots of fun to explore. After a day in the tourist districts, it was nice to come back to our quiet little district and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Manifique”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-petite1
Reviews.Content: We chose the New Orient Hotel from Trip-Advisor based on its fantastic reviews and we were not disappointed, in-fact, it was far better than we thought it possibly could be as it is still very French and not an ultra-modern chic hotel. Cleanliness throughout the Hotel was outstanding. Breakfast in the Hotel was especially cheap in comparison to close by cafes which charged higher prices for an inferior meal. Do not expect a large room as they are typically Parisian sized rooms that are well presented with older furnishings with the wardrobe containing an electronic safe. The bed was just right for us as we both like a medium to hard mattress and had no lumps or bumps to contend with. Street noise during both day and the night was non-existent due to the double glazing but at night there was also very little street traffic as it is in a residential area. We heard no noise from adjoining rooms that were occupied during our stay. The New Orient Hotel appears to be in a very safe district of Paris situated very conveniently being only a 3 minutes walk away from Villiers Metro train station from where you can gain access to all the famous Parisian landmarks within minutes. The Hotel although only a 2 star would put some 3 or 4 star hotels to shame for its cleanliness and presentation plus value for money is assured. We would have no hesitation in booking the New Orient Hotel again should we ever make a return trip to Paris in the future and would not hesitate to recommend it to our friends. The Hotel was perfect for our 7 night stay before moving on to other parts of Europe during our 6 week holiday from 'down under.' Congratulations to Management and Staff that have got all the chemistry right for this unique Parisian Hotel. This Hotel however, would be a disaster for someone that uses a wheelchair or is infirm as the staircases despite the 3 person lift would not be suitable.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PJS-from-Oz
Reviews.Content: We chose the New Orient on the strength of the TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. It is hard to imagine finding better value for money anywhere in Paris. It may be out of the main tourist areas of Paris but that means it is comfortably quiet and unhurried. In any case, the Metro is a short walk away and that will take you anywhere you want. Our room was on the second floor with a small balcony to the street. Noise wasn't a problem with excellent double glazing. The room was charming, clean and comfortable. OK, it wasn't particularly spacious but it wasn't cramped. Breakfast each morning was a pleasant affair served by cheerful staff. All of the reception staff were friendly and welcoming. They all spoke English quite well which was valuable for me because my French is non-existent. If we ever get back to Paris, staying at the New Orient will certainly be on the agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: atomic1111
Reviews.Content: New Orient a hotel with descent location in Paris. Subway stop is a few minutes away, with easy connections to all of Paris, including train stations and airport. Rooms are clean, and well maintained, but quite small and basic, so don't expect any extras over here. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Winner”
Reviews.Author: Tessica
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the end of September based on the reviews of Trip Advisor. Reviews are correct. You get so much quality for your price. It has the best features of a bed & breakfast and the best of a hotel. The decoration of our small but adequate room was lovely. We enjoyed a tiny balcony where you could sit with a drink & gaze at the street below. The neighbourhood is lovely with well kept buildings & the typical French balconies. It was a12 Euro taxi ride from the Gare Nord. Taxi's in Paris are great & honest if you deal with the registered taxi's. There were gypsies trying to steal you away to their cars so be sure you are at a proper taxi stand. We were greeted warmly. Bags were stored until our room was ready (only 11AM). We received directions to Brasserie where we enjoyed a wine but got conned out of a few Euro. Oh well it is Paris. .... Nothing is cheap. The owner had our bags in our room. We picked up sandwiches at the bakery down the street as well as orange juice etc at the small grocery store across the street. This store was a treat to pick up salad or juice or coke etc etc. Very handy. After a nap we were off to enjoy Paris with directions from our host. I cannot say enough good things about the assistance our two hosts & their staff provide. We had a recommendation for a restaurant a short walk away that was excellent. All recommendations were "bang on". There is also a laundromat just about across the street. I was helped by the locals with the machines etc & actually enjoyed seeing what goes on. It is handy & next time I won't bring so much "stuff". I will use this hotel again anytime I come to Paris. I know however that I will have to book ahead as with all these great reviews, it will fill up quickly. I

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Balki B
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but clean. The locations was near Gare St. Lazare, which is close to Gare du Nord. This isn't in the midst of the main sightseeing areas but still quite close. The Moroccan night-porter downstairs was a very pleasant guy, and the view from our attic room was wonderful. I have no complaints. Never been in a nicer 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JustChad1
Reviews.Content: My mom and I recently stayed here for three nights in a twin room. The hotel is absolutely charming. The rooms were small, but tastefully decorated. The beds were comfortable and and the in-room facilities/conveniences were clean and of adequate size. The hotel is located on a peaceful street within five minutes walk to the Villiers Metro station, allowing quick access to Paris' major points of interest. We did not partake in the breakfast offered by the hotel, opting to enjoy cafe cremes and fresh croissants from the cafe located on the corner of the same block. Several restaurants are within walking distance, and a small grocery store is located directly across the street. I must say the one thing that stands out about this hotel is the level of service you receive once you walk in the door. Someone is always manning the front desk to offer advice or answer questions with regards to Paris. And we were always greeted with a friendly bonjour/bonsoir upon entering the hotel...such a nice touch. Mr. and Ms. Wehrle and their team certainly understand the importance of good customer service and I feel they do an outstanding job in presenting this each guest. I chose this hotel because of the review it received from the New York Times and because of the outstanding reviews on the site. And I must say that this hotel certainly lives up to its reputation. When my future travel plans call for Paris, I will look no further for a place to stay...I'm sold! Other conveniences to mention, complimentary internet in the lobby, and free wi-fi throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A winning experience”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights while on business in Paris on the strength of a recommendation from one who travels to Paris all the time. Great value for money. Very clean room, friendly staff, and as others have mentioned far from the hustle and bustle yet only a short metro ride from everywhere I needed to be. Great neighborhood for anyone interested in music. There are a bunch of instrument makers all around. Have stayed on the Rue de Rivoli in hotels 4 times as expensive -- but for simple comfort New Orient is tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: Ok I've travelled all around the world and I rarely ever write reviews but this little hotel was quite compelling! I say so because for the price I paid, I really wasnt expecting much. I was pleasntly surprised by the hard work of all the staff, including the concierge who greeted me every morning and cheerfully insisted on carrying my luggage each time. The room was cozy and well cleaned, and the bathroom had really good water pressure. A bit of noise from the metro at night but this wasnt a problem when I closed the window. The hotel is outside the city, but the metro was convenient enough for me (only 2 minutes to station). I was really impressed with the friendliness of staff. I dont know if its just a french thing, but I was treated like royalty. This hotel is worth the mention, worth the money and then some!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with one exception which wouldn't stop me from staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: Rettoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently. We arrived around 7pm on our first night and were greeted by lovely staff at the front desk. Our bags were whisked to our room door while we got our key. Our room was very clean and comfortable with an ensuite which included a bath & shower. The shower had great water pressure and was very welcoming after a long day of sightseeing! Beds were also very comfortable! Our room was street facing and unlike other reviews, we didn't find the street noisy at all when the windows were open and we didn't hear anything when the windows were closed at night. We had dinner locally that night - can't remember the name but it is out front door of hotel, turn left and cross over the street to a restaurant located in the middle of Rue de Constantinople and another one. I think it was Restaurant Acacia? This was ok, filled a gap but we didn't eat here again and i don't think any of us would recommend it. We had breakfast in the hotel on our first morning and this is our exception I mention in the title. We didn't actually think very much of what was on offer for breakfast and in fact didn't eat breakfast here again. There is a lovely boulangerie 1/2 block away from the hotel (out the front door & turn rightm walk 10 seconds & it's on the corner opposite you!). They do lovely coffee and pain au chocolat as well as the usual French breakfast fare. This is closed on a Monday morning so we found another one on a street directly opposite this boulangerie (opposite Hotel Relais Monceau on corner of Rue du Rocher) which was good but the best one is definitely the one closest to the hotel. You can sit in both to eat your breakfast at leisure rather than walking & eating. A plus point of this hotel is that it has a Franprix supermarket (not very big from the outside but is very surprisingly excellent - has everything you could possibly want and more in there) directly opposite the front door. This is open until about 9pm/10pm most nights except Sunday when it is only open until 1.30pm. Get any water, etc here. Transport-wise Villiers (on both Metro lines 2 & 3) is the nearest metro station and this is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Villiers is a great station as it is quite central and the lines serving it are excellent re getting to alot of places you'd want to go to. It is quite easy to walk to alot of places from here weather permitting and if you are so inclined. We had beautiful weather and so took the opportunity to walk as much as we could. On our 2nd night we had dinner in a local italien - Pizza Scusi - which was lovely and I would recommend eating here at some point. Very nice pizza and lovely house red! We did want to return on the Sunday night (it opens on a Sunday night which is unusual in the area so beware) but check when they are open from. We walked in at around 7pm and were told they weren't open yet, that we had to come back after 7.30pm. I have seen elsewhere that say they are open from 7pm. This was annoying as we had to find somewhere else that night and found an Indian on Boulevard des Batignolles near the pharmacy. It was actually quite nice. All in all New Orient Hotel is a lovely hotel with a great location and services/shops on it's doorstep. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone. We booked here because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Sheadsav
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at New Orient. As a single female traveller, on my first overseas trip, New Orient was comfortable, friendly and safe. ROOMS- I stayed in a single room, which was tiny, but very clean and well maintained. Traditional and very Parisian! LOCATION- a little way out of the city, but this was no trouble at all. Very easy to get the train to everywhere I wanted to go. The suburb itself is very quiet and made me feel safe. Within walking distance of Montmarte- my favourite night in Paris was when the concierge reccommended a little traditional restaurant called "Le Petit Canon" in Montmarte, where I had my most authentically French meal (amazing duck!). There's also a little bakery about a block from the hotel with beautiful Pain Au Chocolat. So fresh! SERVICE- very helpful concierge, took the time to tell me everything I needed to know and mark it out on maps. BREAKFAST- simple, but delicious and fresh. There's not a lot of close-by places for brekkie, so it was convenient and great to kick-start big days of sightseeing If I went back to Paris, I'd definitely stay at New Orient again. excellent value for money in expensive Paris.

Reviews.Title: “You can't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: EduRiker
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for my honneymoon after a long research. The hotel is easy to find, a 2 minute walk from the Villiers metro station. The neighborhood is very frenchy, with lots of boulangeries and restaurants. There is a small supermarket right in front of the hotel. We checked-in, and found a very nice room waiting for us. A little bit small, but you can't ask for better in Paris with this rates. We took the elevator every time, as the stairs are a little bit tiring. Our luggage were broght to us in the room a few minutes later. At the desk there was a beatiful card signed by the owners congratulating on the wedding, and a photo frame as a gift. A very nice touch. The bathroom is adequated and worked very well for us. I found the street a little noisy at night but you can't hear anything with the windows closed. There were no problems to speak english with the staff. They are all very polite and ready to help for whatever you need. I borrowed an adaptor to charge my laptop with a 20 euro deposit which they gave me back when I returned the device five days later. In the end, when we were leaving to take the bus to go to the airport, the owner chased us down in the street saying he had a better solution for us. As it turned out, their daughter were arriving that same night, so they offered us a ride to the airport. A very nice gesture, as taking the bus and going to the airport with the luggage is always a struggle. So, we got ourselves a ride and talked a lot with Catherine, the owner, who is very simpatic, and told us about their hotel and how much they love what they do. She wouldn't take money for the ride. A great experience, we loved our stay and will be back there anytime in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: PerthAussie19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and could not fault the place. It is in a great area, not far from the major department stores of Printemps and Galleries Lafayette. There is a large choice of restaurants minutes from the hotel, with a Laundromat and Grocery store directly across the road. The room and bathroom, although small, were comfortable and clean, with a great shower. From reviews on Trip Advisor I was expecting something less than what we got, but we were pleasantly surprised. The staff are extremely helpful, and go out of their way to assist. If you dont mind a pleasant walk of about 25 minutes, you can walk to the Louvre from here. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a very good hotel and great value for Paris.”
Reviews.Author: ivyhyng
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my friend on a multi-city trip of Europe, and it was our first time in Paris. We stayed at this hotel for 6 days, and our two twin bed room was on the first floor, facing away from the street. It was relatively clean although our first impression was that it was very small and odd that the toilet was across the room from the bath/sink. After a day, we got used to the room and it was comfortable. The hotel was in a nice location and very close to the Metro Stations Villiers and Rome. My friend and I enjoy walking so we frequented the shops close by (over by the supermarket Monoprix), and it was a short walk to Parc Monceau (5-10 min) and relatively pleasant walk to Montmartre (20-25 min). If you walk along the main stretch headed over to Montmartre (Bd des Batignolles) there is even a Starbucks on the way (it was her lifeline so we thought we'd pass this tidbit on). There is a really good restaurant close by called Patio provençal (also close to Monoprix), that was our favorite of the ones that the staff had recommended. If you have time definitely go to this restaurant. We also liked the location in the sense that the immediate area was not a tourist trap and it felt very safe. The housekeeping staff had a habit of leaving the windows open after cleaning our room but after only one request from my friend to the front desk to keep the window closed this never happened again. The TV had channels in French, German and English. All of the staff we encountered spoke English well and were extremely helpful. We had an early morning flight on the day of departure but they were very accomodating, allowed us to check out the night before and called a taxi for us. My only negative comment would be that if you are a very light sleeper or extremely sensitive to noise, this might not be your kind of hotel. There will be rumbling noises, I am assuming from the Metro lines being so close by, all times of day, and occasionally you can hear your neighbors walking, talking or flushing the toilet. Because the windows faced inward you sometimes hear the dishes, the garbage being emptied, or side conversations when they were open, but that was not a huge deal. Good thing my friend and I were so busy most of the day and by the time we came back to the hotel we were too tired to worry about that! All in all, a very good hotel and great value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeraJo320
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 6 nights at the beginning of September. It was my first time to Paris and this hotel was so comforting to go back to in the evenings after a long day. The room was small but comfortable. The bathroom is fantastic, spacious, and great water pressure. We got a double room with a bath, room 3, which is right above the lighted entrance. The windows open to a beautiful little Parisian street, which happens to be quite noisy... BUT with the windows shut almost all of the noise is blocked out, and the blackout curtains block all the light from the exterior. A/C was used, and very effective. All the staff were extremely curtious and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: goodeats22
Reviews.Content: The staff were great! They answered my e-mails before our arrival to help us navigate were we should get the train to Avignon which was so helpful when you don't know the area and want to buy your tickets ahead of time. They got us in our room very early as we were so tired from our overnight flight. They spoke very good english and were helpful making reservations and giving directions. The hotel was in a very convenient location. Walking distance to 2 different metro stations and there was a grocery store directly across the street and a small bakery within a half a block that had delicious pastry and great cappuccino. It was a bit small for 3 people but perfect for our 2 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet gem”
Reviews.Author: gwenl380
Reviews.Content: This well located hotel is well priced and close to major attractions. We walked easily from Montmartre with only one stop to have some wine, watch passers by and listen to some "gypsy Jazz"in a bar. The Metro was a 5-10 minute walk with a bus around the corner. We were 4 women and had no second thoughts about taking the metro home at night. The rooms were comfortable, clean and there was wii fi for those that need to be connected. There were also good restaurants near by for a good meal after that big day of touring

Reviews.Title: “Will return...”
Reviews.Author: k s
Reviews.Content: The proprietors of this hotel, Catherine and Josef, and their staff make this a great find in Paris. They were very accomodating with my schedule which meant my arrival in Paris got off to a perfect start and they were always accessable for questions. I originally thought this hotel would be a bit removed from the city centre but on arrival found it to be perfectly located between several hip neighborhoods and also within a short distance to multiple metro stops. Yes, my single room was petit but it was plenty for me to get around and be comfortable in for the short time I was in the room and because it is a quite neighborhood I slept well at night. Most important, it was well kept and clean with both airconditioning and windows in addition to the easily working wifi. I tried to rebook this hotel for my departure from Paris as well but unfortunately they were already fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen E
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the New Orient based entirely on reviews on tripadvisor and it more than met my expectations. It's centrally located and only 10 minutes walk from Villiers metro station and is very easy to reach if arriving by Eurostar. The local area is attractive with a range of bars and restaurants and feels very safe. It's also close enough to walk to the city centre if you're feeling energetic. Check in was welcoming and very quick and my single room, although small, was more than adequate for one person. My room overlooked the courtyard at the back and was very quiet with no traffic noise. Staff are courteous, professional and friendly. The hotel is exceptionally clean and tastefully decorated. Breakfast was basic but very good with fresh bread and pastries and piping hot coffee. There is a supermarket directly opposite which is handy. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quiet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: graemeThailand
Reviews.Content: check in smooth,room clean and this small hotel well maintained.Very easy to get around paris from here.there's a small market st nearby with an excellent baker.A good nights sleep to finish the day and friendly helpful staff for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: biztravel365
Reviews.Content: This property is excellent. It has a great location near the Villiers metro station that connects to Line 2 and Line 3. Don't let the proximity of the hotel to the sights deter your decision. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is safe and a lot of fun to walk around. It's far enough away from the touristy areas so that you get a good taste of Parisien living. Great cafe's, restaurants, bakers, butchers, cheese shops. The hotel rooms are clean and very quiet. I did not spend much time in my room but it had everything I needed including great A/C. The limited interaction I had with the staff of the hotel was excellent. They are very friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Rovinglibrarian
Reviews.Content: I went alone to Paris on my first visit for 36 years. My stay was excellent, due, in part, to this hotel. The location is good - a brisk walk to St Lazare and a leisurely stroll to Parc Monceau and surrounding area. The decor is tasteful and impeccably maintained. The staff - all of them - most obliging and pleasant. Special thanks to the desk service. If I go back to Paris in the near future I would not hesitate to book again. Merci.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly hotel well placed for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: SaleMariner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in August 2011 with our young boys (4 and 6). Staff were all very friendly and helped us get our bearings for our sightseeing. Very convenient for buses or metro. Our rooms were comfortable and clean and breakfast was good. Would recommend - particularly considering price.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Good C
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights here for my budget honeymoon. I couldn't believe how perfectly clean it was here and service was excellent! It was our first time in paris and we were so unprepared because of our wedding, we had to ask hotel concierge everything from where to go, what to do and how to get around. What I was most impressed by this hotel was how all the employees are so willing to help you. My room was cute but bathroom needs little work done. This place is in a great location. really close to train station but in a clean neighborhood and lots of cafes near by.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, perfect stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinC
Reviews.Content: We had a 24 hour layover in Paris on our way to Italy and decided to stay at the New Orient Hotel. They were wonderful, they emailed back and forth with us before we got there answering questions about transportation, activities, etc. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was very warm and welcoming and even chose and made reservations for us at a great local place, Patio de Provence, where we had a great meal we continued to talk about in Italy. I would definitley love to stay here even longer!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Passionatehawker
Reviews.Content: This is great value for money. Small rooms but beautifully appointed and spotless. A terific location lose to Rue de Levy, Rude de Dames, Place du Clichy etc. The staff are friendly and professional - nice bathrooms, safe available, close to many Metro stations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Calpino
Reviews.Content: We chose the New Orient for a 4 night stay based upon TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Clean, very friendly and ideally located for our first visit to Paris. It is so nice to get personal service from the proprietors and to know that they are managing the business themselves. They have selected their staff well to ensure that all the guests are made to feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marco K
Reviews.Content: After booking a different hotel and found that we did not like that hotel at all, we came across this little gem. We came knocking at 10PM and the man at the reception was very helpfull and gave us a chance to view the room. We did not want to pay before we had seen the room. We were shown the double room with bath, room 23 on the 5th floor. We were very pleased, it was very clean and big enough for a comfortable stay. Digi tv but all in French (can't complain cause we were in France after all). A/C worked good and not noisy. Hotel is quiete at night so good night rest. Walking distance to Arc de triomphe and Eiffel tower (takes a good walk though) Metro near by and the yellow bus route on the L'open bus toures. This is recommended, take the 2 day hop on and off pass, it is only a few euro more than the 1 day one. Breakfast was good, good range of selection to choose from. Would stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “We wished we had more time to spend at The New Orient Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlyr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The New Orient Hotel for only one night, at the end of our Paris/Normandy trip. The hotel is convenient to the Gare St. Lazare train station, and, if you are up for walking the city, is within walking distance to the Seine and all the sights. (We walked to Ile St. Louis and back). The hotel is quite charming and historic. Given the smaller size of the room, the bathroom was spacious. The room was comfortable and well-appointed. The staff was extremely welcoming, patient with our attempts at French, and conversant in English when we weren't. The balcony with the bistrot table was a nice surprise, and was the perfect punctuation to our visit to France. In the end, we wished we'd had more time to stay at The New Orient Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris and impressed”
Reviews.Author: Kiwistyles
Reviews.Content: I onlygeton tripadvisor when it's either really good or really bad. This place is GOOD! It is well located, well priced and the service in magnific! It is very personal, all of the staff go out of their way to make your stay great. Merci Catherine for your fine hospitality, and hopefully the All Blacks beat the Roosters this world cup.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: NattyMLee
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay in Paris and New Orient made it a special one. Great rooms, superb serservice, friendly staff, delicious breakfast and handy to amenities (superette and laundry next door). Also the area is well known to taxi drivers which made it easy. Parking was also available on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian charm without breaking the bank!”
Reviews.Author: FullOfWanderlust
Reviews.Content: While planning my first trip to Paris, I didn't know where to start and turned to TripAdvisor, as I always do, for suggestions. The New Orient Hotel s by far the best bang-for-your-buck in Paris! The staff speaks both French and English, an instant +1 for those not fluent in French (me) and includes a wifi connection and air-conditioning, amenities rarely seen abroad in a room less than 200 USD/night, which is also a great price for the summer. That being said, the rooms are tiny, but perfectly sufficient for a short stay and serve all necessary needs for a vacationing person or 2. Ideally located near 2 Paris Metro stops, you can easily reach the heart of Paris in less than 15 minutes. And to boot, the restaurants near the hotel are FABULOUS, some of the best we visited in Paris. I HIGHLY suggest Le Patio Provencal, north of the Villiers Metro on Rue des Dames.

Reviews.Title: “Superb! will be back”
Reviews.Author: smartpauline
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are amazing. The hotel is in a residential area, which was an added attraction ... Very central location, with a metro and bus stop very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: Italyl0ver
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at New Orient Hotel for 3 nights during August 2011. We would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very helpful : Josef Wehrle the owner provides a personalized service being both professional and friendly. The rooms are spotless, the beds are very comfortable . The continental breakfast was amazing : delicious home made "pain aux créréales" and pastries. To conclude :the location is perfect, service is stellar, and the rooms are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianMellor
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day break in Paris and staying at the New Orient Hotel. The hotel was excellent living up to its very high ratings and the staff and proprietors were very friendly. Hope to revisit again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: heather s
Reviews.Content: i am returning to this wonderful hotel in March 2012. This is by far the best Hotel I have visited in Paris. Good value and very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KerryP164
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has incredibly steep and perilous stairs but also a lift which took us up to our 6th floor bedroom and teensy bathroom. While very small all round, the room had french doors for fresh air and the staff were incredibly helpful with all our enquiries. A lovely room for breakfast and located in a business district, made for quiet weekend traffic. Good access via the metro, and a reliable place to stay. Kerry P

Reviews.Title: “Good location in quiet Paris neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: snorkelinthesun
Reviews.Content: The staff was welcoming and helpful. The neighborhood was nice, but if you don't speak perfect French stay away from the Lebanese restaurant down the street - we were treated rudely there. Loved the mini mart across the street from the hotel AND the bakery up the street. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: luke_owen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Orient Hotel for five nights in August and thought it was great. It's true that the rooms are quite small and simple. Double bed (which we found to be very comfortable), wardrobe with two drawers, two bedside cabinets, dressing table and a mirror. We stayed in a room with an en-suite shower and found this to be perfectly acceptable (the water pressure was great and we never ran out of hot water); some people have said the shower rooms are a little small but we had no problems with it at all. The view was of the street, which was pretty quiet. Speaking of which... we stayed there in August and found that almost every shop within a one-minute walk was closed. Two things: 1) shops seem to close on Mondays. 2) The whole area goes on holiday in August for something called 'conges annuels'. We didn't know about this - oops. However, it wasn't the end of the world at all - we simply walked down to the Place de Clichy and found that pretty much everything was still open. We recommend "Le Melrose" (near the Place de Clichy) for French cuisine at 39 Euros per person or Hippopotamus (also near the Place de Clichy) for American-style dining, if that's your thing. The staff at the hotel were always friendly, helpful and polite. We only had breakfast on one day; it was basic but very nice - croissants and jam, that sort of thing. The hotel is quite easy to find, a few minutes' walk from Villiers metro station, although I think you can also access it quite easily from the Europe metro station, too. Villiers metro station is quite well placed (on both Line 2 and Line 3, if memory serves) for doing the typical touristy things in Paris. We visited the Eiffel Tower, La Defense, Les Champs Elysees, the cathedral at Notre Dame and none of the relevant stations were more than twenty minutes away. No tea or coffee-making facilities in the room, incidentally - which was a bit of a surprise. There's a Marché Franprix (a mini-supermarket, basically) literally opposite the hotel which sells all kinds of stuff. That's open until 9pm and they weren't on conges annuels when we visited, despite it being August. All in all If you're looking for five-star luxury, this isn't it. But if you're looking for somewhere that's really nice but on a relatively low budget, this is a great hotel to stay at and they'll make you feel welcome. If we go back to Paris we'll certainly be staying at the New Orient. We had a really lovely time and miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - we would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: MenloParkRose
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel in a quiet area, with ready access to the Metro and restaurants nearby. The rooms are small but nicely furnished. The staff could not have been friendlier and more helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and would happily return. Excellent value (we had two rooms - one for our daughter and one four ourselves) for the price you'd normally pay for one room in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Momof4boys72
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and charming rooms. Conviently located near the metro and many sites. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff who stored our luggage for us after checkout until our departure from Paris. We loved the view from our room. A great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, great value”
Reviews.Author: freesailorIT
Reviews.Content: After some researching, I booked at New Orient for eleven nights and I'm very happy for the choice. I agree with most of the comments read here, so I have little to add. Absolute cleanliness, staff friendliness, excellent location (two metro station just a few hundred meters away), quiet and elegant neighborhood, good breakfast, great quality/price ratio. All equipment (shower, hairdryer, TV, ...) worked fine. I really hate malfunctioning hotel showers and that is usually one of the very first thing I check, luckily I found that mine was perfectly manageable (and so the rest)! A bed very comfortable and quiet surroundings, no problem to sleep without worry. WiFi is free and worked well even with my quite old smartphone. Hotel is really fine but I think that some caveats are needed: - the hotel has just 30 rooms and is deservedly esteemed so I think it's advisable to book in advance (I did it one month in advance). - rooms could be less spacious than expected. My single room on 6th floor (the uppermost one) was perfect for one person, apart the built-in wardrobe put in one corner of the room, which had barely the minimum space required to host just my mid-sized suitcase put in horizontal and had quite small shelves. Not really annoying, there was enough space anyway, but better to know that in advance. I suppose that double rooms or maybe even other single rooms could have more spacious wardrobes. - stairs are narrow and steep (they reminded me of some Amsterdam's hotels, even if not so much steep!). Lift stops at landings between adjacent floors (e.g.: 3-4) and not exactly at floor, so you have to go down a few steps. - continental breakfast is not from a buffet table, glutton be warned! As for me, I found it to be very good and abundant enough for my morning hunger. - TV remote has a key to switch between satellite channels and DVB-T channels, use it if you want to see all channels! The district is elegant and quiet but not dull, thanks also to some lively zones with restaurants. I didn't tested restaurants in the neighborhood (apart one of the many brasseries near Villiers Metro station, nothing special) so I can't say anything about that, I just noticed there are many. All in all, I agree with a comment read here that said you haven't to expect a four stars hotel at budget price but for sure I stayed in many three-stars hotel much less enjoyable than two-stars New Orient and at higher price. New Orient is now my top-choice hotel in Paris, for sure I'll try to book there next time in the "Ville Lumiere".

Reviews.Title: “A completely wonderful trip, would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: sheano
Reviews.Content: Had a delightful stay at the New Orient Hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff there. Charming red flowers outside too. EXCELLENT value for money in an expensive city. Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights. We loved this place and its location. Atmospheric rooms in an old French house, very friendly and helpful staff (fluent English!), decent and quite quarter with short walk to the metro and only a few stops to the major hotspots.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessGrumpy2
Reviews.Content: I took my son to Paris at short notice in the peak holiday season, so was glad to get a room at New Orient given its good recommendations. We thought it was a wonderful choice and would go back. The staff at reception and in the breakfast room were great: very welcoming and wanting to help. They were always happy to come and serve drinks on request in the little breakfast room during the day, even on Sunday afternoon after the Tour de France finished :). We had one of the slightly larger rooms which was pretty big by Paris standards; spotlessly clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is close to two metros and lots of restaurants, two supermarkets and an exceptional patisserie. The staff were very helpful in recommending local places to eat (Le Coin was our favourite). This was a very comfortable and relaxing base for a week of intensive tourism; we slept and ate (breakfast) really well here. I enjoyed being out of the main tourist areas. The only negative was very minor: the lift access is a bit difficult if you have heavy bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pom20
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay as many before have already said. We found all the staff we encountered to be helpful and easy to speak to. The room was very clean and facing the street, but we did not hear any traffic noise. The metro was within easy walking distance to head out on our daily trips. We would stay again. If you do end up going to France have a great time

Reviews.Title: “Excllent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LALNG5
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is a delightful place to stay, beautifully presented without being fussy, spotlessly clean with friendly and helpful staff, with English spoken. The area is an attractive, safe, quiet part of Paris with a beautiful park nearby, lots of restaurants, a small market on Saturdays. It is within a walk of Le Pigalle and Sacre Coeur, and has three nearby metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Smudger7
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a long time searching for a hotel in Paris when she stumbled upon this little gem on Tripadvisor. I will start with the negatives though as I wish to end on a high. Firstly, the rooms are small, but then again what do you expect for a room like this in Paris. It was cosy enough for us and we only really used it as a base of operations. The elevator was difficult to navigate with two of us and a suitcase! Secondly, the room was a bit plainer than the pictures suggest on the website. Other than these two points the hotel was fantastic. We had a fantastic room with a balcony on the top (6th) floor, with a great view. The hotel was immaculately clean and the cleaning staff were great and even laid out my magazine on the bed neatly for me while I was out for when I arrived back. The staff, well what can I say they were brilliant. They knew a lot about the local area and were very keen to help and exceptionally friendly. They also all had excellent English. In terms of location it excels again. There is a Franprix just opposite, great to pop into and load up on water, snacks etc. There is a superb patissire just down the road which was great, we had breakfast from there most days.The metro stop (villiers) is no more than a 5 minute walk away. Thank you everyone at the New Orient Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for three nights when we were in Paris. When we arrived, the staff were very friendly and accommodating to our early arrival. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and everything worked as it should. The air conditioner worked pretty well. The windows kept out almost all of the outside noise, but we could hear loud conversations, coughs or sneezes from adjacent rooms (not a nuisance at all, just an observation). The staff was very accommodating to our requests for wine glasses, bottle opener, and any thing else we needed. The surrounding neighborhood isn't too exciting, but offers a grocery store across the street and a few decent places to eat. The metro is a short walk away. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service but not much character”
Reviews.Author: mcfrog55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were rather disappointed with this hotel. We had asked for a quiet room but were given one overlooking the road - not a busy road, but noisy enough to male us close the windows at night and use the air-con which I usually try to avoid. Our room was small( though very clean) and didn't look like the rooms on the website and lacked character . Although the hotel is situated close to a metro station, there is not much to see in the immediate vicinity - so not a great location. All the staff we met were charming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely room and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: julienexpat
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in this hotel. I had asked for a quiet and cosy room and they gave it to me. For this quality of service (pleasant staff, good cleanliness) and a rather good location (2 minutes walking from a metro or 12 minutes walking to Saint-Lazare metro and train station), the price is honest. The only reproach you can make is the size of the room : tiny ! Nevertheless, you can spend your money in this hotel since that is a real 2 stars pleasant hotel in Paris (I would even say a 2.5 stars hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kookie57
Reviews.Content: We had the most enjoyable 4 night stay at the New Orient Hotel. Easily accessible by Metro, it is close enough to the action of the city but nestled away in a quiet little quaint niche, surrounded by eccentric music stores. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful - Amar and Micheline were a wealth of information. The breakfast area was bright and was tastefully decorated with china teapots. The server was extremely attentive and responsive to making our breakfast a relaxing and enjoyable experience. The room although small was cozy and very comfortable with large windows that opened to a great view of the rue de Constantinopole. After a long day of walking the bed was so comfortable and inviting! Will definitely be returning to New Orient Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “ComfortableAnd pleasant”
Reviews.Author: adiexplores
Reviews.Content: Short but a very pleasant stay. I was traveling alone and this turned out to be the best place to crash. Very small rooms but also very comfortable. The owners were very good and helpful. Close to St.Lazare station and a decent walking distance to Louvre. Highly recommended for short quick stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: coconutsmoothie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location - close to transport however many "touristy" places are easily covered by foot as well. My room was pleasant enough however very small and a bit claustrophobic after a couple of days. The bathroom was tiny and if you are a large person you might find getting in and out of the shower quite difficult. The breakfasts were disappointing however not to end on a negative note, the staff were fantastic and endlessly helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very much enjoyed the New Orient -- great staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: dave_curado
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of July 2011. The staff was excellent! Friendly, helpful, thoroughly enjoyable! The rooms are very clean. Slightly small, but for me that is expected in Europe. Location is great! It is in a central location, but Rue de Constantinople is quiet. Thank you for a great stay New Orient staff!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly. A very "French" experience.”
Reviews.Author: BillCapeGirardeau
Reviews.Content: A very quaint European hotel with a lot of flair. Room was small but in Europe they usually are. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. Our room was on the 5th floor with an interesting view of Paris. Location is a little far out, but Metro is very close. A clean, well-maintained, hotel that will try hard to make you happy. Watch out for the elevator...it is most...unusual!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the New Orient Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LindaAE
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. My friend and I were in Paris for 5 days before travelling to London for the summer. We had researched hotels on Trip Advisor and decided on The New Orient Hotel. What a great decision that turned out to be for us!! The staff at the New Orient was SO HELPFUL!!! We do not speak French and it really made a difference to us having such a kind, helpful and experienced group of people to help us make plans and give us directions. They also could tell us about the hidden gems that only a local would know. The rooms were charming... comfy, very clean and well kept . We loved the feeling of being in a beautiful Paris neighborhood and having such a warm welcome when we got back after a day of sightseeing!! If you are looking for a REAL Paris experience where you are not in a "cookie cutter" hotel ... we strongly recommend New Orient Hotel. I should mention that my friend and I have both travelled extensively. This is the first time I have ever done a Trip Advisor review but after our stay I wanted to share this information.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and service! Wonderful hosts.”
Reviews.Author: traveler10201141378
Reviews.Content: Catherine and Josef Wehrle are excellent hosts- kind, attentive, provided excellent advice/directions. Allowed us to check-in early. After a long day of sight-seeing, it was so nice to come back to our beautiful, clean, and comfortable room. It's an easy walk to the city centre in comfortable shoes but it is also close to three metro stops (Europe, Villiers, and St.Lazare). Also, there is a wonderful crepe cafe down the street. Our room also had a lovely balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel in Central Paris!”
Reviews.Author: whm3200
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel for our family vacation in Paris. There were 5 of us (3 rooms) and we found the New Orient a great value! Located in the Europe section, it is close to Metro and the Train (Gare St Lazare), has many dining options in close proximity and even a Marche (grocery) across the street. The staff could not have been more helpful with directions and recommendations and even provided an ice bucket and glasses for our wine(s) each evening . They really contributed to the great experience that was our trip to France. The rooms, while small(ish) were nicely furnished, the beds were very comfortable, the bath/shower plenty large & modern and the small balcony with seating/tables and flower boxes really made for a comfortable room. The A/C worked well (it was in the mid 90's). The center spiral staircase is a bit steep but there is a lift. It's not a "cookie cutter" hotel, it has character and charm. I would stay in the New Orient again, without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Smart, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Sidatkins
Reviews.Content: On business with an appointment around the corner the next day, this hoel was the ideal location for me. The reception was great - fast easy check-in - the room was clean, and a reasonable size, with window open to the front room. Breakfast was very good and service was quick and efficient. Be realistic that this is in the commercial centre of Paris so delivery vans arrive from 5am and can be noisy! Not the hotels fault, but if you are a light sleeper I suggest you ask fro a room at the back. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Would Return”
Reviews.Author: PaulNY
Reviews.Content: A good deal for the money. Rooms are about 12-15 ft square but very clean, well furnished, good beds. Very friendly and helpful staff. You can manage quite well with just English. Quirky elevators - they hold just 2 persons and stop are in between floors, letting out onto the winding staircase. If anyone is coming up or down the stairs when you get in/out, you have a traffic jam. It is a quiet and safe area in the music district, and you can sleep with no noise worries. Market across the street, and laundromat a few doors away. Also a handful of restaurants and bakeries are short walk away. Continental breakfast @ 10 euro is pleasant enough, but probably not worth 10 euro. Free wi-fi from rooms. About 12 TV stations, just one (CNN) in English. The front desk will call taxis for you - which will show up in minutes IF any are available (as we found out, there is no guarantee that they are). New Orient is about equidistant between two metro stops - Villiers and Europe. Each is roughly 8-10 minute walk. Gare St. Lazare is roughly a 12-15 minute walk. Big stores (Galeries Lafayette, Aux Printemps) are also 12-15 min walk. Opera is 15-20 mins walk (good to know if you plan to take Roissybus from CDG, or Hop-on Hop-off tour busses, because Opera is where they stop).. So there is a tradeoff - the hotel is not in the most convenient location, but it's a safe area and pleasantly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: JackReacherFan
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by friendly helpful staff. We had a real surprise on arrival in our room to find that our hosts had provided us with a wedding present as they knew we were on our honeymoon! A lovely gesture! Our room was very clean and well furnished with a comfortable firm bed. Staff were very friendly and helpful with assisting in booking activities and even kindly printed some of our internet bookings that we had done using their free Wifi with our smartphone. This hotel is within 5 mins walking distance from 3 different metro stations and it was also only a 20min walk to the Opera House. The area is very quiet with restaurant options in the vicinity, a laundrette and supermarket are located across the road. Overall, we thought that this hotel was excellent value with no compromises on service or facilities and far exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: designtravels
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel in the 8 arrondisment. Very quiet. Clean and friendly helpful staff. My recommendation would be to request a room on the front as these rooms are larger with small balconies and since the street is so quiet it's quiet acceptable. These rooms are slightly more expensive but worth it. The special internet rate gets you a very small room with sloped window looking at the building behind. Not so good for a couple. The location is not as convenient as the 3 arr. and it's a long walk to the Seine, Louvre etc. but if you're up for it I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: DD514
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel. Staff went above and beyond to help arrange taxis and reservations. All front desk staff spoke English. Rooms were small but beds extremely comfortable. Good location in safe area. Free wifi. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little clean Hotel-Good price value”
Reviews.Author: Madrid2000
Reviews.Content: Like mentioned in a lot of the reviews is a nice little clean Hotel close to the center of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful and Friendly Staffs”
Reviews.Author: tzecheen
Reviews.Content: wonderful helpful and friendy staffs. thanks for the help and advice given during my stay. room is very clean and spacious for 2 people usage. the facilies are new too. location is at a non-tourist area but is within walking distance to metro and train station and tourist shopping area. Will be top of my choices when i return back to paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Content: We spent several nights here and found the staff very helpful and the facilities to be a good value. The standard room is small but sufficient, the superior room more spacious for those travelling heavier. Nice quiet location near Gare St. Lazare, with covenient metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Schuby8
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how nice and charming this hotel is for the price! It isn't in a peak Paris tourist neighborhood, but is well served by the wonderful Paris metro system and it actually feels more like real Paris in my opinion. The room was small but well appointed, charming and clean. A little rough around the edges which I would expect at this price, but nothing to be scared off by. The staff was all very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Would definitely recommend for a budget stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorpar_11
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel, it’s owners and staff. They were so warm, friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect, close enough to walk to most of what that we wanted to see and do, but in an area that seemed to be just outside of the hustle and bustle. Two Metro stations, on two different lines make travel from here simple. The room was very clean, nicely furnished and comfortable. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and would return to the New Orient Hotel on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Celine315
Reviews.Content: We loved the New Orient! Catherine and Joseph and everyone on staff were so friendly! They spoke English with us and were very helpful with restaurant recommendations, travel, etc. Even the cleaning staff were very nice. We also liked our room - we found it to be plenty large and nicely decorated with hardwood floors and a small balcony. The bathroom was great with ample storage and it was also updated. The hotel is in a nice, safe residential area and very close to the Metro. It is within walking distance of Park Monceau which is a great place to enjoy lunch or breakfast in the sunshine. There is a small restaurant downstairs if you want to eat in the hotel. This hotel is great and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Semily
Reviews.Content: Great value, spacious (for Europe) rooms, excellent service, very clean, great location and family operated. A winning combination.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff !!”
Reviews.Author: UndercoverGuest
Reviews.Content: Look no further if you are searching for ah hotel near the centre of Paris ! Spotless rooms of reasonable size (large for Paris !) comfortable beds, great staff, easy to get to places. Wonderful recommendations on local restaurants. When people get to know of it it will doubtless be booked up well in advance. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris !!! One small point - If you are going from the Gard du Nord, don't take the RER to St Lazare and walk...Take the metro from La Chapelle (there's a walkway from GduN) and get off at Villiers. It's a little more difficult, especially if it's your first time in Paris, but a lot shorter distance to walk

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, charming rooms, "local" feel”
Reviews.Author: hayeric
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. We came for our honeymoon and, after mentioning such in an email once, we found in our room a gift and an adorable congratulatory card from the owners. Unlike some of the "ritzy-er" hotels that look like fancy hotels you'd find anywhere else, New Orient definitely makes you feel like you're in Paris. True, the rooms are small, but it's Paris--most rooms are small. The size was fine for the two of us. The balconies--complete with a little table and pretty flowers-- are beautiful and the rooms are quaint. The service is exceptional. The location is a good 15 minute walk to l'Arc de Triomphe and a 25-30 minute walk to Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, and others. At first I thought I'd mind this, but we really enjoyed coming back to a non-touristy place to rest. Also the Europe Metro stop is two blocks away--which we used quite a bit. The neighborhood is fabulous--we walked through an amazing farmers' market today on Rue de Levis. So many wonderful boulangeries, patisseries, bistros, etc. right down the street with all of the atmosphere and the authentic feel and without the crazy Paris traffic noise and millions of lost tourists. Bottom line: if you want to feel like a local but still get exceptional value and a beautiful place to stay, New Orient is the spot.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: rezuar
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel with exceptionally friendly and helpful staff (esp. Ms Mc Carthy) is situated in a quiet and safe (compared to other parts of Paris) residential quarter, only some five minutes from the nearest metro (Villiers). Gare St. Lazare was only a ten min. walk away, which makes this hotel an excellent base for exploring the right bank on foot. The left bank is easilly reached by metro, or - which seemed more convenient to us - by bus links n 21 and 27. The hotel and its rooms are spotless clean and have a lot of atmosphere. We stayed in one of the rooms on the top floor - it was rather small but we stayed minimum time there. The size of the room was fully compensated by our two balconies with fabulous views over the street - it was probably the most romantic place we´ve ever slept in. It is obvious that this hotel is very well looked after and that its owners really love their place. We will be back. Soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely owners”
Reviews.Author: DandMRidgefield_CT
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here last month. This hotel is pretty much as others have described it on trip advisor. Very small rooms but super friendly owners who were extremely helpful and speak several languages. The hotel is in a pretty good location near plenty of good restaurants-especially one, one block down. I would go back again. I think our room rate was $130 euros without breakfast which at the dollar right now is a little less than $200 a night. Our room was small with a view of other buildings but "hey" we were just sleeping there. I thought the beds although small were very comfortable. The room is small so be sure not to bring large luggage. And my daughter and I are small people so the size of the room not a big deal for us. But again, I cannot reiterate the friendliness of the owners and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: g00dthingsinlife
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and lovely staff, will definately be back, Excellent location, good restaurants nearby e.g. La Dome. great supermarche across the street, which also has a great off license and lovely pattiserie right beside hotel. We will be back, highly recommend this hotel, pristine and such lovely staff. A true gem we found after much research. Thank you for a great base in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous-quiet, safe, convenient, family-run, clean, affordable, quaint&local”
Reviews.Author: rwebb88
Reviews.Content: This was WONDERFUL find in Paris!! Best kept secret!! It was such a charming hotel. It's run by a family who is very friendly and greets you each time you enter&leave the hotel. it has a cute spiral staircase to the top, as well as a small elevator. The room was spacious for European standards. It was maybe a 3 minute walk to the "Villiers" metro station and it was pretty easy to get around the city by metro. There is a restaurant and bakery located within a 2 minute walk of the hotel for quick meals, breakfast, snacks, etc. The hotel also offers room service. My mom and I usually ordered a tray of coffee and tea to the room each morning and it was about 4-5 euro...not too bad!! It was clean and very nicely decorated...very beautiful and very Paris!! I liked that it was a local place too....very quiet and in a quiet, safe, neighborhood....not touristy either! I highly recommend it! I booked through the hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ScottNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the New Orient with my wife and three children. The "family room" accomodated 4 of us with our 19 year old occupying a single room one floor below. The service was great and although they were "undergoing renovations" (carpet and painting), the owners went out of their way to ensure we were not inconvenienced in any way. I reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris, great location (between Metro stops), great neighborhood and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AngelaW80
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with very friendly staff. The room was small but perfectly formed, with an immaculate bathroom and charming furnishings. There is everything you need within a 5 minute walk, including a great bakery for croissants! Great location for using the metro so you're wherever you need to be within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - great location”
Reviews.Author: ROM30K
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in April and found this hotel to be great. The staff were very helpful and recommended a great place to eat just down the road. Close to a number of metro stations so really easy to get to. Rooms are good size for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: lewis42
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, affordable hotel in a good location in Paris. We were lucky enough to get a little balcony on the top floor which made us feel like proper Parisiens as we could spend a little time watching the world go by from up there. The room was small but comfortable and the staff were the nicest people we met in Paris and spoke perfect English. Only down side was we were woken early every morning for one reason or another as the walls were very thin and there was always something going on inside or out. But given how good everything else was we certainly couldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: CASchmaltz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, and suited our needs very well. When I booked the room I left notice that our plane would be in late (after 11 PM) and the receptionist was waiting for us to come in and left the front doors unlocked for us, which I thought was especially nice once I learned that the doors were locked after 10 PM. All the different people at the desk spoke very good English, and seemed tolerant and appreciative when I tried to speak to them in my broken French. If you are traveling with a lot of luggage, I would recommend asking for a room on one of the lower floors as you have to walk up a few narrow spiral stairs even to get to the elevator. They were happy to give us directions, recommend restaurants, put in wake-up calls and call for taxis. When the receptionist (not sure if he was the owner or not) saw me struggling with carrying my luggage down the stairs on the day of check-out, he immediately jumped up and insisted on carrying them for me not only down the stairs but also out to the taxi. As for the room itself, it was small compared to American standards, so we found it necessary to actually use the wardrobe in the room. There was free Wi-Fi, and we had no trouble using it. The room was clean, the bed and pillows were very comfortable and warm, and there was climate control in the room. The balcony was the big seller for me though, it was wonderful to step out onto it and breathe in Paris in the morning. The hotel is across the street from a grocery store, in walking distance of a street market, an atm machine, and close to 3 different metro stations. Be warned though, this is not a party or nightlife neighborhood. People are inside asleep by 10 PM and businesses are closed on the weekends. There are few people on the streets late at night, but it was very safe. Personally I really enjoyed this after visiting noisy tourist traps in the daytime because it meant that I could have some peace and the quiet made for a good night's sleep. If you want the busy nightlife stay in the Montmarte village instead. If I ever find myself back in Paris I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BWWblaxx
Reviews.Content: I must confess the area is somehow deserted but being a few steps away from two Metro stations, you'd be happy to have found this quiet, clean hotel in Paris. The price is affordable and the service is top notch. Gone are the days where one would expect a cold and indifferent approach as a tourist in Paris. I can't emphazise enough how friendly and attentive they are. The hotel was going under a few renovations and that included waking up to an alarm early in the morning - this could have been an inconvenience to us and somehow they managed to warn us and apologize in advance and it was never a bother. For every single thing, the staff went out of their way and we were very impressed. As an older building, the steps to go up are small and steep - don't be afraid of the unique tiny elevator The small rooms have a lot of character and the beds are very comfortable. The owners and management have certainly accomplished to make the most out of what they have and the results are impressive. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. If the price fits your budget, you'd be happy to go back here after a long day of site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: upandaway08
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the single room. It was very small, in fact I couldn't fit my suitcases anywhere so had to cram besides the bed and put on the bed to open them. Despite that the room was very clean, nice, modern and comfortable. I spent most of my time out, and it was a very nice soft double bed to lay my head on at the end of the night. There was one day I had to do some work on my laptop - after finding the cafe's too distracting to work from, I spent a few hours in the room working at the desk. The hotel was very quiet and free wifi was great. I must say all of the staff were so wonderfully helpful and friendly. The breakfast, not included in my stay was a little overpriced, however there's a wonderful patisserie just meters from the hotel, and a supermarket across the road so you can really eat cheap and well. It is the only hotel i've stayed at in Paris, but I found it to be very pleasant, conveniently located and although I'd probably shop around for something a little better value for money (again i have nothing to compare to so this may have been a bargain), would definitely consider staying there again. If you stay here you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Miffymiff
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights and couldn't ask for more. The room was superb, the staff were very friendly and the location I must say is close to anywhere. Choose this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A serious gem!”
Reviews.Author: Zeks101
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful little hotel, super clean and nicely decorated rooms. Wonderful staff who are incredibly helpful. The location is good, in a nice neighbourhood. It took us about 15 minutes to walk to the Champs/Arc de Triomphe, and about the same to get to the Opera area. There is a metro station very close by, and it took us no time to get to Sacre Coeur/Montmartre. I can't say enough about this hotel, especially given how affordable it is compared to other places in Paris. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BobandBetty83
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with this hotel... it surpassed our expectations in every way,Firstly it was as clean as a new pin but with just the right amount of character not to seem clinical. Secondly the staff were helpful in every way without being intrusive. Thirdly the location suited our needs perfectly with a little supermarket opposite to get all the things we required and an open market just up the road with fresh produce but just four minutes from the metro station We will be booking again for a winter break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam_and_Si
Reviews.Content: For only a 2* hotel this place is really impressive. Good location, easy to access via the Metro, and reasonably priced (for Paris!). The interior was clean and bright, everything looked freshly painted, with antique furniture giving character. The service was really friendly and the recommendation of 'Le P'tit Canon' (a local bistro) was excellent. Each morning we were woken with a delicious smell of freshly baked bread and pastries. This was a great base for a 3 night stay in Paris and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Really, really good”
Reviews.Author: HoopyHoop82
Reviews.Content: We could not find a bad thing to say about this hotel. Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Really clean room, albeit quite small but definitely big enough for the two of us. Close to metro and train lines. Quite a few nice places to eat and drink within walking distance. The hotel is near a road but the sound proofing is just brilliant - slept really well both nights. As we arrived, they were just finishing laying new carpet, for which the owner was very apologetic but there was no need to be - the new carpet looks great! We had breakfast in the hotel on one day and it was great - on the Sunday, we ate out at a nearby cafe, which was better to be honest - it was a bit better value. The toilet in reception is amazing by the way - use it if you get the chance!! Having free wifi was very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay even with Hotel Renovations”
Reviews.Author: docksmith
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the New Orient Hotel on March 31 and April 1st. It is located in an area that is convenient to the metro and the main attractions in Paris. My room was spotless and even though on the small side was adequate for all my needs. The people who staffed the front desk were very personable and were always willing to dispense useful advice to this tourist. Travelers should note that this is a small family run hotel. The owners obviously care about its maintenance and were in the process of painting and renewing the central staircase. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would hope to be able to bring my wife with me to stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MelandTom2010
Reviews.Content: It is a good choice for Paris it is expensive! The room was small the shower was really small! But it was clean and a pretty good location! Close to the train station! Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Base to Explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: iseestars
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for three nights for a long, girly weekend. We chose the New Orient Hotel based on the reviews on here and the price. I booked a Twin Superior room which had a balcony and a bath. The hotel is located a short walk from Villiers metro station. I was surprised that the hotel is only 2 star when I think it could really be more like a 3 star hotel. When we checked in, the man at the reception was very helpful, took our bags and showed us to the lift. Our room was on the second floor and we had a great view of the typical Parisienne street and a lovely little balcony. The road was quite noisy but as soon as you closed the balcony doors, you couldn't hear any noise from outside. The soundproofing was excellent. The room itself wasn't what I had expected - judging by the pics on the website I thought we were going to get a room which had more antique furniture - but the room we were given was clean, a little more modern (which suited us fine) and was big enough for the two of us and our cases. Beds were really comfy and we even had a tv! The room also had free wifi - very useful for checking Tripadvisor before we went out to dinner ;) Our room was cleaned spotlessly everyday and the staff were always very welcoming and helpful. On the last day we had breakfast in the hotel and that was cheap and filling at only 8 euros each for the continental breakfast. I guess the only things that could be improved in the room would be the lighting and the amount of plug sockets. I think there were two plug sockets in the room, which is fine, but we're two girls who are blow drying our hair, straightening our hair, laptop plugged in, phone on charge - an extension cable would have been useful ;) Also, there wasn't a main light hanging from the ceiling - just three small lamps - one by the dressing table and one each by the twin beds. It wasn't an issue at all until it came to get ready for nights out - we ended up elbowing each other for the prime spot in the bathroom mirror! Easily solved I suppose with some higher watt bulbs? But that's seriosuly the only thing that could be improved. We loved the hotel and would happily go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreum
