Reviews.Content: I had a most pleasant time at this hotel. It is very charming and has a very friendly and helpful staff. It's very well situated, close to the Gare Saint-Lazare, which means that you can quickly go anywhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: ttmccarthy
Reviews.Content: What a great place to staff the staff were fabulous close to most of the attractions but far enough away to feel that you are not in a tourist area. We asked for restaurant recommendation for our 25th wedding anniversary could not be happier great food reasonably priced. The hotel is very Parisian and in walking distance to most things but also close to the metro. The staff were just fabulous and only too willing to help. Would recommend with out hesitation

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: lodding
Reviews.Content: just stayed there for 3 nites at the begining of our 4 week trip of europe...i was very happy...close to 2 metros....lovely entrance...supermarket and laundry accross the rd...elevator (people have complained that its little it isnt 2 huge suitcase and 1 man or 3 people no problems if there isnt enough room its back down in 2 minutes)...rooms beautiful large spotlessly clean with nice bathrooms (we had 2 huge suitcases on the floor and could still walk around the room)...shower was large...bedding was superb (i need to ask catherine where to buy the doona from heavenly)...breakfast lovely...staff excellent and again house keeping 5 star.....i can not fault this hotel in any way....it pretty...its well priced...its clean...its perfect...our only issue was with local eateries and the lack of engish menu's.....i would recomend this hotel to anyone....and i cant wait to return at the end of 4 week trip for another few day....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: royaloakmichael
Reviews.Content: We were happy staying here. The room was lovely, and the breakfast was very good...well worth the price. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: burgerqueen700
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, was undergoing a renovation at the time but did not affect us. Spotless rooms and spotless bathroom. Lovely and friendly staff. Spent 4 nights end of Feb here and enjoyed immensly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: mushyface
Reviews.Content: I booked a long weekend in Paris for myself and my partner and decided on the New Orient based on the reviews here. The hotel is located on a quiet street in the heart of the 8th district near Villiers and Europe metro stations. There are a number of other hotels on the street, as well as restaurants and bistros offering cuisine from different cultures. As an aside. If you are arriving from Paris Gard du Nord, I would suggest you consider a walk to La Chapelle and catch the metro to Villiers, as this seems to involve a lot less walking than the proposed Magenta to Gare St Lazare (long walk to hotel) method. Check in was perhaps the most simple I have ever had in my life. I simply stated my name and was given the room key. No ID check. No Credit Card swipe. Nothing. We were asked if we would like breakfast the next day and were given instructions on how to find the room. That was it. The room itself was a double with shower with a view overlooking the main street. The windows can be opened to allow fresh air and the sounds of Paris to reach your senses. As we were on one of the lower floors, there was a concern that street noise (with the windows closed) would be a problem, but the sound proofing was very good and this was never an issue throughout the stay. The bed was very comfortable and although the room was not large, it was not restrictive in its size. The bathroom was much the same and the shower had both a good temperature and power range to it. The walls are a little thin (or maybe my partner has very good ears) as she could hear every word that another couple were saying in another room on the floor. Breakfast was fairly standard, with two different menus to choose from. Nothing to write home about, but perfectly adequate in itself. The Wi-Fi is free and easy to setup. The security password is available in the rooms (as opposed to those hotels that make you ask for it) Other things worth noting. The room was cleaned and tidied every day to a very good standard and every time we passed through reception area we were given a friendly welcome by the member of staff on duty. For the price, you will not get a much better hotel in the Central Paris region.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: fjal
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, just a short walk from metro station. Very friendly staff, spotlessly clean room and bathroom. Tiny balcony overlooking street - no problem with traffic noise. Had breakfast on a couple of days - the continental option which was plenty. There were a number of restaurants and cafes with a couple of mins walk. Reasonably priced, good location and perfect for a long weekend break. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very French, very quaint, renovated rooms with a touch of French!”
Reviews.Author: vincenewm
Reviews.Content: This is the quintissential French hotel. Situated in the suburbs, away from the hustle and noise of central Paris but easily reached via the Metro (stop is at the end of the block). We stayed 5 days and Catherine or her staff helped us every day with information and valuable tips (they speak English and are very accommodating). Breakfast at the hotel is a bit pricey for what you get, but you can easily have breakfast anywhere in the neighborhood. There's even a supermarket only a few blocks away. Right now, the hotel is undergoing a renovation to comply with new fire codes and is expected to be completed this April (2011). Do not be afraid to stay there as the major part of the renovation is complete and now they are working on the finishing touches. I enthusiastically recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: fischi19
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over a weekend in February 2011. As we booked on short notice and the hotel was already fully booked, we were offered single room for 2 people. Mrs. Wehrle told me in advance that the room would be small but i was surprised that it was just fine. Our room was on the top floor, with nice views over the neighboring areas. To our surprise everything was extremely clean and very quiet, which is not normal for a hotel in paris. Check in was very easy and convenient, the same for check out. The Hotel has a small breakfast restaurant, but we didn't try it. WiFi is complimentary and very neat, easpially if you are a tourist and you're looking for a place to eat or so online. They were doing some refurbishment in the public areas of the hotel but they did it without distracting their guests. Upkeep is very good and the minor ongoing construction was hardly noticed. It should be done by now. I strongly recommend this hotel. It's not expensive, clean, friendly, uncomplicated and quiet. All factors that don't come easy in Paris. Well done Mrs. and Mrs. Wehrle! Congratulations, a true bijoux!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: belongsinamuseum
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers, we picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor recommendations. We were not disappointed. During our stay, the hallways were being remodelled slightly to comply with some new building regulations, but there was no noise from this work while we were in the hotel. Our room was well-appointed and clean, making good use of the space. The furnishings were tasteful and everything in the bathroom was in full working order. The only exception was the lack of fan in the bathroom, but nowhere we stay seems to have one - are they really that rare? Paris was relatively cold during our stay, but our room stayed cosy and warm, and had the best hotel bed I've had the pleasure of sleeping on - firm mattress, big soft pillows and warm duvet. The walls were very thin - we were woken up one night by an excitable couple talking loudly on the phone, but they had just arrived and he had proposed on the plane on the way over, so it was forgiveable! Other than that it was a very peaceful hotel, possibly attracting guests who are in Paris for the culture rather than the nightlife. Location-wise, it's not bad. There are a couple of small good museums very close by (particularly the Nissim De Camondo), and it's easy to get to by bus or metro from the Gare Du Nord. We found that the area closed down on Sundays more than some other areas - we spent a good long while trying to find a late lunch snack, but came up with nothing, only to hop on the metro to Montparnasse and find that everywhere was open! The number 21 bus was a good friend to us during our stay, going from the near-by Gare St Lazare right through the centre of the big museums district. In fact, I would highly recommend any potential visitors to Paris to find a bus map - it would have done us the world of good! There was a very personal feel to the service, the staff knew who you were and picked up conversations where they left off the previous evening. We didn't try the breakfast, but the room looked lovely. There is free wifi throughout the hotel, and a computer that is free to use in the lobby. All in all, a gem of a hotel in a quiet area that I would not hesitate to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: OurMrsReynolds
Reviews.Content: A very attractive, well set-up hotel. The staff were very jolly and happy to help when they could. The street seemed more residential than tourist-y, which made it nice and quiet, but also meant shops and cafes tended to be closed every time we went past. The hotel is not more than ten minutes from buses or metro lines in any direction, so very convenient in that sense. And the room was lovely, nicely furnished, clean and with a good amount of storage to make up for not being particularly spacious. My only hesitation for returning to this hotel on subsequent stays is how VERY thin the walls between rooms are. I don't blame the hotel for this, as it's more likely a problem they inherited from the original renovations, but ear plugs are a must for undisturbed sleep (although, I'd like to say a big congratulations to the couple next to us who just got engaged. I hope you can get that ring re-sized soon!). Ultimately, the hotel was charming, rooms were well appointed and the price extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel, with 5 star feel”
Reviews.Author: dianeperth
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 who stayed 4 nights at this wonderful, clean and friendly hotel. The location was, convieniently, within walking distance of the 2 Metro stations. A local street was blocked off and became a market place during the day , selling everthing from fruit to clothes. There was a very French feeling to the area, not too touristy and of course the patisseries were numerous and to die for!! The staff at the New Orient were so helpful, friendly and spoke excellent English. Our room , although cramped with 4 people, was decorated with gorgeous duvets and was warm during the cold nights and always cleaned well, daily. I hope to return to this wonderful establishment one day soon

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic and Quaint Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Hart817
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a value hotel, in a great location, with friendly service New Orient definitely fits the bill! This was my first trip to Paris and I had made my travel arrangements only weeks prior, so I didn't come very well prepared. I was very grateful then that the owners spoke fluent English and were very helpful in recommending restaurants/bars. Everyone was very friendly and helpful that worked there. The room itself was small (we stayed in a double with a shower on the fifth floor), but on par with hotel rooms in other large cities. It was perfect for us though; we like being cozy! I'm not sure how big the rooms with multiple beds are, but given the size of the double, I would not recommend sharing a room with a friend unless you are really fond of each other. Our room overlooked the courtyard; it was very quiet all three nights. The street was not very busy so I imagine if you have a street-side room it would be just as quiet. There are several quality restaurants in walking distance, two metro stops only a block away and a convenience store directly across the street. So to summarize if you're a couple looking for a budget-friendly retreat with fantastic service that welcomes everyone, including English-speaking gay couples, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good location, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Oslo84
Reviews.Content: Reviewing this on the basis that they market themselves as a 2-star hotel, it's perfect! Great service: We arrived a bit early (and hadn't given notice) and our room wasn't ready. We were told we could leave our luggage at the hotel, no problem. Had coffe and a croissant at the next door bakery, took a walk past a nice park down to Arc de Triomphe, subway back again, and by the time we got back to the hotel, our room was ready and they had even put our suitcases in the room! We had a nice room with a french balcony toward the street. The street may have some traffic during daytime, but at night it was pretty silent (and the doors are pretty soundproof). Two bakeries close by, a small one next door, and a slightly larger one at Rue Larribe (between the hotel and Villiers metro station). Small grocery store across the hotel, (mind the hotel room has no fridge). Nice, clean bathrooms, which seemed fairly new (we had a room with a shower - nice pressure). Small steep stairway in the hotel, floor space could fit two small suitcases, but I would probably think twice if I was going there with heavy loads of luggage. They do have a tiny elevator though. They were doing maintenance in the hallway when we were there, but there was no noise that bothered us, and maintenance has to bee done, so I'm not going to complain about that! Better to do it now than during high season I assume. All in all, a wonderful and charming non-chain 2-star hotel, with excellent service and great value for money! Free wifi is always a bonus too. By the way, I stumbled upon a street market in Rue Levis next to Villiers metro station, very nice and charming.

Reviews.Title: “For comfort and a friendly service - this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: DublinRayIreland
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, lovely room and a bed just as good as your own. We thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend in Paris courtesy of this hotel and its friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back....”
Reviews.Author: Finchin
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped inside the door we felt welcome. The staff are a delight - so helpful and a genuine cheerfulness. Our room was so good - the bed was like being at home in my own bed - I have never slept so well away from home. Close to the Metro and a lovely little brasserie at the top of the road - oh yeah - and a patisserie 100 years from the hotel - is that Heaven or what!?

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than some 3 stars I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: ardraleah
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to book this hotel because it is only ranked two stars but had read so many good things on TripAdvisor that I felt it was a risk worth taking and it was. The hotel is so clean, is in a great location (best pain au chocolat is just one block away...turn right out the front door) and is charming to boot. We were there in January but the balconies off the rooms would be particularly nice in the spring and summer. I have stayed in many hotels in Paris, and this is one of the best deals. The only negative was some day-time reno-work that was a bit noisy when we were recovering from jet lag. Also, we didn't go for the cheapest room - we got the next grade up so that we would have a bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!! Can not fault it. Thankyou Elizabeth & Josef xx”
Reviews.Author: elliejaynejones
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this place, location perfect within easy distance to all the main attractions, street was quiet that the hotel was on so slept the best I have for a long while! Rooms spotless, the maids did s brilliant job it wad immaculate every time we got back! It was my birthday whilst we were there also an I even had a card and a present waiting for me when we got back from a long day out and about! Little touches like this to me make all the difference! I will be going back to Paris again an undoubtably will be staying here again! It wad like being at home! Thankyou Xx

Reviews.Title: “Cracking Parisian styled hotel”
Reviews.Author: DangerousDave81
Reviews.Content: A lot has already been said about the new orient, the key points being. * Brilliant hosts who do all they can to make you welcome. * Great central location within a short walk of 5 metro stops * Cosy rooms that are very comfortable and well maintained. They are not small! * Very competitive prices for central Paris * Spiral staircase that will be fine for most people, if not there is a small lift that has been retrofitted into the old building - not a problem for either my wife or I. Would definatly return here for subsequent paris trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Katherine227
Reviews.Content: Excellent value boutique hotel - all major attractions can be easily reached by metro (the station was just 5 mins away). Staff is very accomodating and the hotel is clean and well-maintained. Free wifi is another big plus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this EXCELLENT hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisjgregory
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New Orient Hotel to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary, having stumbled across its entry in TripAdvisor (from Eurostar hotel booking) where it was ranked 18th out of 1842 hotels in Paris. Booked New Orient directly online, got a good deal, all very easy, much cheaper than Eurostar. The room was cozy but not small, comfortable, clean, in fact almost everything you could wish for. The only thing it hadn't got was a kettle and cups to make an early morning drink. The staff were very polite and helpful and spoke good English, and were happy to make coffee for us at any time of day. The hotel itself is about 200m from Villiers Metro station, from here you can get to virtually any attraction for sightseeing. There are good eating places within easy walking distance. We would certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service in a Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: sarah0527
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here before and after Christmas and were very satisfied with the hotel. The service was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and cozy, and the wireless was very useful. The location was also very useful as we could hop on a subway within a few hundred metres and there were plenty of restaurants nearby. We even walked to the Champs d'Elysee everyday. We would definitely recommend this hotel to those going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: antoine1946
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the New Orient without difficulty and was surprised how near it was to the metro. The hotel is an oasis of calm and comfort with a warm friendly welcome, warm comfortable, quiet rooms and the cleanliness you hope for; all at a price that is rare in Paris offering exceptional value for money. Breakfast was of good quality in a cosy breakfast room. The locationof the Hotel near Gare St Lazare, in the middle of the music shop area, was excellent for travellling throughout Paris by bus or metro. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would whole heartedly recommend the New Orient

Reviews.Title: “So impressed! Was more than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: NicoleR81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New Orient for only 2 nights and it was nowhere near long enough. I booked online and emailed the hotel to state that I was arriving early and ask whether there was wifi in the rooms. I received a prompt response from Catherine stating that they would hold our bags if the room wasn't ready, and that there was indeed wifi in the rooms. Upon arriving early (ie 11am), I was pleasantly surprised to find our room ready and waiting. People have noted that the rooms may be small, but we didn't find them so at all. The bedroom, with cupboard, safe, dressing table and bed sides was more than adequate and the bathroom was definitely on the large side. The rooms and bathroom were immaculate and there was nothing we wanted for. If I had a query, Josef was more than happy to assist (with a bottle opener, glasses, helping with our key card etc etc, whatever we needed). My only sadness is that we only had 2 x nights and we didn't get the opportunity to make more of the hospitality. Lastly, my french is practically non-existent and Josef and Catherine were so lovely that they spoke English the whole time, and were so open and friendly. Would stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a lovely Paris trip.”
Reviews.Author: GEED9
Reviews.Content: While planning our trip to Paris my boyfriend and I made our final decision on a hotel based on the fantastic Trip Advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. We arrived early in the morning and the staff were fantastic about holding onto our bags and taking them up to our room when it was ready while we explored Paris. The hotel is very well presented from the outside and the lobby has been renovated and is lovely. Our double bedroom was a good size and very cosy. We had a little balcony overlooking the street and the room was always very clean.The nearest metro, Villiers, is about a 2 minute walk from the hotel and from the next street you can see the Sacre Couer. There are lots of restaurants around the area and a lovely local market. The staff are amazing and the owners even sent a Happy New Year card upto our room. It really is a perfect little hotel for a getaway and we will definitely return next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: galleygirl74
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone and looking for a safe, clean, friendly, well located, quaint, unique, small French hotel. I found my match with New Orient Hotel. The room was located on the top floor, it was small but had all I needed. Quiet, warm, free wireless Internet. Everyone working on the desk were friendly and helpful. Great location close to metro stations and walking distance to many sights. I loved my experience at this hotel and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & proffesional stafffs ,full of hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: fukulele
Reviews.Content: I stayed two night 30th and 31th Dec.2010,on the way back Japan from UK. I tryed to join new-year-countdown at the park near the Eiffel Tower. Because of congestion I came back later I told them in advance. The front staff treat me so kind as usual. The room is not so large but is kept cosy, especialy its water closet is superior in cleanliness and good designed. I asked and request them about some things (readjusting security box,keeping baggages...),they did with much of kindness and politeness. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean and run by super delightful and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Wesley_11
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the New Orient. The hotel is Paris quaint, clean and good value. I appreciated the free Wi-Fi. It was very helpful. The staff are so friendly, helpful, and their English is very good. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe or 5 minutes on the subway. The owner of the hotel is so lovely, kind and helpful. Made us feel like we were part of the New Orient family. Would definitely stay there again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Keith012
Reviews.Content: Never stayed in this part of Paris before and found the location ideal for Gare St Lazare and visiting some favourite sites. Staff were extremely helpful and recommended a great and affordable local bistro (Le Petit Canon).

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with an excellent location and kind, professional staff. Lovely.”
Reviews.Author: PacificOceanTime
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel very much. I had a comfy, nicely decorated and very clean/tidy room; the breakfast choices were perfect, and the dining area and the lobby/reception area are very inviting. I really appreciated the less touristy neighborhood, which is close to the metro and good shops, cafes. The owners and other managers were all unfailingly nice and helpful, as was the staff. I hope to stay there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: ArndKaiser
Reviews.Content: Due to a medical emergency in August 2010, my wife and I were unable to go on our trip to Paris which would have taken us for a five night stay to the Orient Hotel, that I booked on the internet. We were surprised - to say the least - that in spite of cancelling our reservation 3 weeks prior to our expected stay at the New Orient Hotel, the whole amount of the $ 180 deposit was withheld. So... buyer beware !! Arnd Kaiser

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed in many hotels throughout Europe - this one had the best value for the least Euro”
Reviews.Author: travellots55
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old son and I stayed here just before Xmas for 2 nights. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, the location is fantastic and it has everything one could need. The bathroom was extremely large and even had a bath tub with a shower, and a shower curtain - (unusual in Paris). i would not only recommend the NOH to friends, but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great value , great stay”
Reviews.Author: 032611ww
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days at the end of 3month european trip and loved this place that has well deserved reputation and that was a great bargain in Paris. Although the room was small, it was very clean and very comfortable in the layout including good size desk with TV and ample closet. Bathroom was of larger size and also very clean and comfortable. It was quiet and easy place to get good rest. The breakfasts were affordable and very good food presented in a pleasant cafeteria space. staff was very helpful ( solid english skills ) and went out of their way to provide tips on travel and restaurants and tourist destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, smart and clean”
Reviews.Author: mwwilliams
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel. We arrived having come from blizzards in Wales. pleasantly surprised by warm, snug room, Few minutes walk from two Metro stations, plenty of bars, cafés, supermarkets, restaurants. Great as a base for exploring city. Staff useful for restaurant suggestions and very friendly. Only point to note is lift has been put in after the hotel was designed so a bit of a squeeze (3 peeps max) and requires fancy footwork to get into/out of. Not a problem for luggage, though, as helpful staff deliver it to your room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Rgroll
Reviews.Content: Neat, clean, very French, charming and a bargain, too. Very small but pleasant and quiet room facing rear courtyard. Internet freely available in former telephone booth in lobby. Continental breakfast at 7 euros fine but with wonderful patisserie 50 steps to the right, why? Laundromat 50 steps to the left. Ample grocery across the street, but larger supermarket across from St. Lazare station 5 minutes walk. Two Metro choices 5 minutes walk. Any visit to Paris will be at the New Orient in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel - Superb Owners”
Reviews.Author: dhruv8
Reviews.Content: The New Orient Hotel is a very cozy, clean and functional hotel for a budget stay in Paris... The location is not bang in the touristy areas - but the metros are closeby & there is a nice supermarket bang accross from the hotel. Rue De Levis which is just a couple of minutes down the road has a lovely local market where we used to pick up our breakfast daily. From the prompt response to the bookings to the lovely & cozy room on the 6th floor - we had a lovely stay and would like to thank both Catherine & Josef the owners. Thanks to their helpful advice by the end of our stay in Paris we had become experts on the touristy spots of the city & were recommending places to people! They also helped us with a taxi when all the public transport was on strike. A lot is written about their staircase - which to be honest can be a little trying - but honestly we didnt face to many problems. The free internet is an added comfort. Shweta & Dhruv

Reviews.Title: “Lucky to have found this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CherylMorrison
Reviews.Content: If you want an immaculate, comfortable, well located hotel in Paris, don't hesitate to book the New Orient. We stayed a total of 12 nights in October. It made our first trip to Paris really memorable. And even if we could have found this quality in a comparably priced hotel, which is doubtful, it wouldn't have Catherine and Josef Wehrle, the owners and the heart and soul of the place. We arrived exhausted and one is always a little anxious about visiting a new place, but Josef was right at the door taking our luggage and greeting us by name. We felt instantly comfortable. And Catherine is so friendly and unflaggingly upbeat. The beds and rooms are very comfortable. Breakfast is great and the coffee is wonderful. All the staff are friendly, professional and helpful. The hotel's location couldn't have been better, near several Metro and bus lines and an open air market on Rue de Levis which we visited every day. If we can go to Paris again we will only book our airline after checking for availability at the New Orient which feels like our Paris home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dhalia85
Reviews.Content: I visit Paris frequently but this was one of my best visits because of the New Orient Hotel. It is a gem of a hotel. It is extremely clean and cozy. Everyone is very helpful and friendly. I will definitely be back and I will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The VERY BEST place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: etaurins
Reviews.Content: The entire stay here was perfect. The husband and wife owners and all of their staff were friendly and very informative. Everyone at the desk spoke English and helped with suggesting nearby (wonderful) restaurants, and explained how and where to get around Paris (by train, foot, and bus)...even wrote out directions and store names. The hotel was very "quaint-French", quiet, and near shopping, dining, attractions, and transportation. (We walked to the Arc de Triomphe and Montmartre, and the Opera House). The bed was very comfortable (lots of nice, soft pillows and linen). The breakfast pastries were a good start to each day. I hope to return there again. They let us in our room at 9:30 A.M. A perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: OliandAlexis
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time at this Hotel. Helpful staff and a convenient & quiet location. Easy to get to all the sites and a few nice places to eat close to the hotel. Le Petit Canon and Pomze were great resurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “French style, great location, low prices. Unbeatable!”
Reviews.Author: WatfordWelltravelled
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in November and travelled by Eurostar. We walked to the Hotel from Gard Du Nord which took about 15 mins and were delighted with it when we got there. A lovely building with flower filled wrought iron balconies - far prettier than the more expensive Best Western next door. Our room was adequate in size with stylish french decor - beautiful fabrics, and a comfortable bed. Also a little balcony which picked up some of the autumn sun. The bathroom was clean, plenty of hot water and a miniature bathtub, (not recommended for anyone over 5'10"!). We didnt take breakfast in the hotel on the first day but once we realised the prices elsewhere did so on the second and third days. A small cotinental breakfast is available for E7 but upgrade to E11 and you get cereals, fruit, yoghurts, cold meats, cheeses etc -much better value than anything available outside. A small library of books including some in English in the lounge is an added nice touch. The hotel is situated in a very quiet street but has the advantage of having three metro stations within 5 mins walk. A useful little supermarket opposite. We highly recommend and will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AmyClaireH
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in this hotel in early November, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I had a single room (although it was a double bed), which was quite small however we have to remember people - this is central Paris! Good (and safe) location, nice restaurants nearby, staff very friendly. The stairs are kinda crazy, but there is a little lift. Nice bathroom, comfortable bed. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: disestablishman
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, quiet and friendly. Not bad value for Paris either.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Room in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pulmqueen
Reviews.Content: This is an adorable boutique hotel on a residential neighborhood. You do not need to stay on the Left Bank to feel like you are in Paris! At a fraction of the cost and far less noise and commotion, this hotel is ideal. It is near 3 metro stations and a beautiful park. Our room was in the back, very quiet. The breakfast was delicious and breakfast room is so quaint and enjoyable. The owners were most helpful and pleasant. I would definitely return here again! An adorable hotel in a very nice area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Time4Tea
Reviews.Content: charming hotel, everyone helpful and welcoming, especially with our two sons (aged 6 and 3) a spotlessly clean and comfortable room

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you can navigate the stairs with luggage”
Reviews.Author: Aurora56
Reviews.Content: I do agree that this hotel is a great value for Paris but I am surprised that no one mentioned the stairs. They have a tiny lift which stops in between floors. When you get out, there is a miniscule landing with a set of stairs down and up. Some of the stairs are crescent shaped and some are rectangular. Your whole foot does not always fit on the individual step. You really have to be very careful not to fall...and adding luggage creates a real problem. We struggled bringing the luggage in and out. On the upside, the staff is helpful and friendly and the rooms are small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible, clean and safe - Perfect place for a solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: Beng1973
Reviews.Content: One of the things that I like most about the New Orient Hotel is its accessibility. It's like 5 minute walk from a Metro (Villair) station so it's very easy to get around the city. It's also very safe to go home even late at night because of its location. Hotel room is very clean, although not elegant, but very comfortable and secured. The rate was a litle bit higher than what the other reviews are saying mainly because I booked late already (3 days before). But I think I could have gotten a lower rate had I booked earlier. Staff (front desk person) was English-speaking which didnt make it difficult for me to communicate. All in all, I am a very satisfied customer and would definitely choose to stay again in this hotel when I go back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, comfortable, friendly - a treat!”
Reviews.Author: amazamb
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. I agree with all the other reviews. The rooms are quirky but in fact really well appointed - comfortable bed, lovely white linen, excellent double-glazing, excellent shower, plugs in the all the right places, hairdryer and shaving socket at the right height, nice lighting. A lot of attention to detail, I would say. The breakfast room is lovely with its pretty pictures of dreamily set tables and its beautiful collection of teapots. Little details on the table like a heart-shaped dish for the sugar, the excellent selection of teas, nice jams and lovely breads and pastries make the whole experience of staying in this hotel a pleasure. The staff are friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again when we come to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & great value”
Reviews.Author: oregoncowgirl63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just a few blocks from the Opera House. We rode the Roissy Bus from de Gaulle airport to the opera- then 6 blocks to the hotel. You can ride the Metro to get closer, but we walked it easily. Room was very comfortable. It average size for Paris. Mattress & pillows of good density. Staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place; they make you feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: WBird66
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Paris on business and I came along for the sightseeing. The first thing I can say is that the owners and staff of this hotel make you feel very, very welcome. They really go out of their way to be sure you have what you need. Especially Catherine, but really all of them were helpful and accommodating. Our room was a bit small (2 twin beds) but beautifully decorated, and with a nice balcony looking out on the street. It was also super clean, and the bathroom was just excellent, with a good tub and shower. The whole hotel has a lovely and charming feel to it. It's in a quiet neighborhood full of musical instrument shops.

Reviews.Title: “This property does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: mross41
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of small boutique hotel properties. And I'm the type of American traveler who likes American size rooms when I travel but after having experienced The New Orient, I'm a changed person. After reading the many, many reviews this property got I had to go there and I absolutely was not disappointed. When they say the rooms are clean, I'm talking clean like you can eat off the floor clean and I'm very, very picky. And the bathroomslook like they were just renovated and they are perfect. You have a place for everything and everything is very well thought out. One of the reasons our trip to Paris was such a success was specifically because of this hotel. The staff was wonderful to us, never impatient, always friendly and helpful. And the neighborhood, well, that was perfect as well with many good quality restaurants and a wonderful Farmers Market on Rue de Levis that you must check out. We also liked the restaurant Il Pomo D'Oro for an Italian dinner on Boulevard des Batignolles and Savoye Caffe for breakfast on 13 Bld de Courcelles both only a block from this wonderful hotel. And while it's a tad north of the action around the Seine and along the Champs-Elysees (it will take you 30+ minutes to walk to the Arc de Triomphe) if you learn the Metro (which is very easy) you will have all of this wonderful city at your disposal without the high prices of other hotels that may be more centrally located. And don't let the stories you hear about the French intimidate you, they were kind and helpful to us and very warm. If you want a great French hotel experience in a real French neighborhood with the Metro only steps from your door then this is the perfect hotel for you. It is small but it has everything you need. I hope you love it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Douze points!!”
Reviews.Author: Workforce3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at beginning of October for a few nights and was very pleased. Stayed in a single room at the top of the hotel (6th floor) underneath the mansard style roof ..though the bed is in fact a small double. The room was beautifully appointed, with a small but spotless en-suite..good shower, etc. Free Wi-Fi. Be careful not to drink too much wine though, because if you dont take care when stepping out from the lift onto the old stairway..you could have a sore head the next day, for more reasons than one! I took breakfast there each morning..which was fine..although you can buy it in one of the cafes, should you so wish. Its near a few metro stations, close to many restaurants..especially around Rue des Dames, not far from Parc de Monceau..from where its not a long walk to the Arc de Triomphe and onwards to the Eiffel Tower. The staff in the hotel are very helpful and most have good English for those of us who struggle with truncated school level french! Its perfectly located for anyone travelling into Gare St Lazare but with the good metro system in Paris its easy to get to from most arrival points. I have already recommended it to my friends and would like to think that I will be back there again...provided all these good reviews dont increase the prices! A big "Merci Beaucoup" to all the staff at the New Orient.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this place is true !”
Reviews.Author: gr8mumnz
Reviews.Content: After reading trip advisor decided to stay here. It is fabulous and you won't regret it. The service was amazing as were the rooms. We went expecting small Paris style rooms but had a good size bath room and gorgeous bedroom with large bed and balcony. It was pristine clean. The hotel is near to all metro stations and is much quieter than main tourist spots. We already plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Stay again definitely”
Reviews.Author: Catarand
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days. The very helpful staff, very kind and great location, quiet place. My room was large, nothing went wrong, enjoyed my stay and I would stay again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: higvin
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and reasonably priced hotel with old Paris charm. Our room faced the street but we weren't disturbed by traffic due to the combination of double windows and good air conditioning. King sized double bed, very good modern bathroom and free wifi. Location was good near local restuarants and metro stations. Friendly helpful staff. The lift is a little quirky - between floors approached by stairs and a small landing - but is manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Knowledgeable Hosts”
Reviews.Author: TempleHopper
Reviews.Content: It's a great place to stay. Out of the main touristy bits, yet just a few metro stops away from main department stores and major sights. Best part is it's a short walk from Rue Levis -- a sort of market street with lots of bakeries, supermarket, gourmet shops and cafes. No problem getting meals at all. Try the brioche at Arnaud delmontel (http://www.arnaud-delmontel.com/). Cheap breakfast set (one pastry and a hot beverage for EUR2.75) at Brioche Doree, a chain of casual cafes. Hotel front desk staff were always friendly and ready to share information. And they have a street directory at hand to find those obscure little streets (like where the main Agnes b. store is in Paris). We got a room facing the courtyard (nothing to look at), but it was quiet. The steep spiral stairs were a bit of a challenge, but they've got a lift that stops in between floors so you just have to negotiate about 10 steps to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “short stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: esrafabri
Reviews.Content: it is absolutely 4 star quality, the rooms are very comfortable, bathrooms maybe bigger than necessary(an incredible detail for Paris), and the personnel is very helpful. Very convenient location to all the major sights and two of the main train stations. We recommend as best hotel for value, we will be back soon, hopefully...

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: hypertension
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this hotel, found it to be very clean and the staff (all of them) were very pleasant and most helpful for all our needs. It is located in a very nice area and quiet at night so the windows could be opened for the fresh air. If your hoping for a hotel with large rooms, then this is not the place although I have not found any European hotels with large rooms as Americans are used to. If your looking for cleanliness, then this is the location. Many nice restaurants and sidewalk cafe's withing a couple of minutes of walking.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional care for a surprise welcome”
Reviews.Author: RGARD40094
Reviews.Content: While I did not stay at the hotel, my nephew and his wife did. They arranged to meet in Paris,coming from two different countries while he was on a two week leave from Afganistan, They had not seen each other in 7 months. I wanted to make their reunion special and their stay in Paris a " city for lovers". I emailed The New Orient and asked for assistance in arranging a champagne welcome upon their arrival. This was not a problem and after confirming budget, called with credit card information and all was set. Josef went out of his way to provide champagne, fruit and cheese for a warm welcome. They greatly enjoyed the surprie welcome and had a wonderful time in Paris. Many thanks to the Wehrle family and staff at the New Orient,

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to us and we'll recommend to others!”
Reviews.Author: CnCadventure
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at New Orient. Affordable, friendly, clean, cosy and in a great position. We enjoyed the proximity to the park where we could go running and walking in the morning (which is rare for Paris) (10 min walk to park) and the Sunday market nearby the local metro station (Villier) was also lovely. I made a mistake with our flights and accidentally booked one day too soon. At the last minute, staff were accommodating without any extra cost. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people wanting to live a Parisian lifestyle without an exorbitant bill at the end. Claire

Reviews.Title: “More than met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: SanDiego_CALouise
Reviews.Content: The Hotel New Orient was like our home away from home in Paris. The owners, Josef and Catherine, were so friendly and helpful. They always were ready to greet guests with a friendly "Hello" and to answer their questions. Another staff member, Amar, was very accommodating with our requests. There are many nice restaurants in the area, a small grocery store across the street, and a pedestrian street nearby lined with boulangeries, patisseries, charcuteries, and fresh food markets. The rooms at the hotel were clean and tidy, and our room, on the back, was quiet and cozy. The location was convenient to Metro stations and train stations and made getting around Paris easy. If I ever return to Pairs, I would definitely stay again at the Hotel New Orient!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: rssd
Reviews.Content: Like the title says - this is probably the best hotel I've stayed at yet. We've spent 8 days in a double en-suite room, which was probably the cleanest room I've ever seen in a hotel. The shower was sparkling white, I felt very comfortable walking barefoot wherever, the bedsheets were squeaky clean - the whole deal. The room was rather small (as we'd expected), but had a lovely little balcony watching over the street (Rue de Constantinople). We actually asked for a balcony in the comments section of our reservation form, so I strongly advise you to do the same (only not when I'm coming to stay there again). The area wasn't as central/lively as a hotel in the heart of the Latin Quarter would probably have been, but I think I actually prefer it that way, as its location was perfect for us: a very short walking distance from an amazing Brioche Dorée bakery for breakfasts (among other options, of course - but that's what we preferred), a selection of quiet (though pricey) bars for night time, and two metro stations that allowed us to easily get to the less quiet and more vibrant parts of the city. It's also quite a short walk (around 15 minutes?) to the Opera / Galeries Lafayette area, if that's your thing, and of course the streets around it felt completely safe to walk around, day or middle-of-the-night. Also, over these 8 days I think we've probably met the entire hotel reception staff, and every single one of them, without exception, was ever-so welcoming and helpful, and it's probably worth to keep in mind we don't speak any French (but I think that goes for Paris generally - English gets you what you want and to wherever you wanna be without any problems whatsoever). Bottom line - This was our first trip to Paris, so I don't know how it feels to live in other parts of the city, but I do know that next time we're there we'll have to be in a *really* adventurous mood if we're to look for another hotel. Fantastic value for money, and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very clean - ultra quiet”
Reviews.Author: vitova
Reviews.Content: I've been to several european hotels. While small and cozy, this one provided all the space needed and was very quiet and clean. elevator is tiny -enough for a couple pieces of luggage and 1-2 mid sized people- but all workable! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base of Operations for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: PackLite2010
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed here for five nights in August 2010. The location is far enough away from the city center that you can breathe but close to three Metro stations that allow you to get almost anywhere in the city in minutes. We stayed in one of the family rooms. It was understandably small, but we weren't looking for a place to live, just a base of operations for sight seeing. There are enough cafes and bars in the area to allow for a late dinner and drinks when the sightseeing is done for the day. There is a small grocery store right across the street where you can grab baguettes for a quick breakfast and other supplies for the room. The clencher for me: We left the hotel and my 17 year old son left his wallet, with cash, credit card, and all of his identification (minus passport), in the hotel room. We got home and found an email waiting for us from the hotel's owner letting us know that they had it and would put it in the mail at the earliest possible time. They packaged the wallet very securely and mailed it immediately. My son had his things back within the week. Fantastic service. The staff is very helpful. On several occasions we returned back to the hotel very late, after everything else in the area was closed, and the helpful staff would go into the bar/kitchen area to get us water, orange juice, and other items. They made reservations for us for dinner, helped with baggage, recommended breakfast stops, called us a cab the day we departed, anything you would expect from a concierge at a large upscale hotel. Overall fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hits the Spot”
Reviews.Author: mustard58
Reviews.Content: Well run, friendly hotel. Everything spick and span. I think every room has a balcony - ours did - so you can go out and see for miles down the Rue de Constantinople. Easy to get to from Gare Du Nord. I recommend the area too. Handy for the metro, and plenty of places to eat. I particularly liked the fact it appears to be where all the musical instrument shops are - including one making / selling / repairing just double basses. Lots of quirky little shops too that would just get gobbled up in somewhere like London. I'm sure it's much better value than somewhere slightly closer in, and nice to get just slightly off the beaten track. We saw a car rally go through on our Sunday morning which was just great.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the excellent New Orient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cafe_cyber
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the New Orient Hotel in January 2007, after selecting it on the basis that it was one of the very few 'true' non-smoking hotels in Paris at the time (some of the other so-called "non smoking hotels" had smoking levels, I found out, and probably still have today). Not a small achievement for a French place, as people who have visited this country can tell you. That was my first and only criteria to choose this hotel, and the quick & friendly email responses from the owner closed the deal. I was then happily surprised, upon checking-in, by the immaculate cleanliness, friendly service and great location (near subway entrance, convenience store across the street, walking distance of Opera & Montmartre). It was a romantic getaway and room 22 was perfect, but more impressive was the willingness shown by Ms Wehrle to ensure that flowers and chocolates were in place before our arrival, as instructed. [I am ashamed to say that I did consider writing a glowing report on this website at the time, but got lazy and never got to do it. I am happy to put this to right today] I didn’t even think of calling another hotel when planning a recent stay in Paris last month (June 2010). This time to meet a London-based friend. That is when I realised that the proximity of the Gare St Lazare makes it a great location for Eurostar users. Same helpful staff, clean room (quieter as in the back of the building) and excellent bathroom facilities (yes, I know, hard to believe that all three can be found together in France!). Of course, being located in a character Parisian building, not one room is identical, the plumbing can be heard sometimes and the lift is in itself a funny experience that you will talk about for years to come. But that is part of the charm of this hotel that so many soulless glass & concrete establishments lack today. And without the good advice given by the New Orient Hotel staff, I would never have found the hidden gem that is the Printemps Galerie Lafayette top floor restaurant, nearby. The awards received by the New Orient Hotel since my first stay three years ago, given by well-know travelling guides and noticed by me on the entrance wall, are testimony of the excellence shown by this well-run establishment. Note: didn’t have breakfast there, so can’t comment on it

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, convenient, clean, very helpful staff and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Tallai
Reviews.Content: We had to cancel 3 nights due to illness, staff were very understanding and didn't charge us. Value for money compared to most hotels in Paris, very convenient to Galleries Lafette, interesting music shops close by. Rooms are comfortable, small but all amenities. Would love to return in a flash next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Next time it's straight to the New Orient!”
Reviews.Author: vernvertigo
Reviews.Content: We had 6 nights in Paris and decided to spend 3 on the left bank and 3 on the right. I chose this hotel for our right bank stint based on consistently good reviews here and on other sites. Our first 3 left bank nights were in a more expensive 3-star hotel with a fabulous location close to the Seine and the islands and the Latin Quarter etc. We grew attached to that area and were reluctant to leave at the end of our three days, but once we walked into the New Orient we ended up wishing we had stayed all six nights there! Compared to our first hotel, the New Orient was 25 euros cheaper per night, and for less money we got a lovely room nearly twice the size of the other, with a more spacious bath and two balconies, a much better bed and fluffier pillows, new double-glazed windows, in a quieter area. It also had a much, much better AC -- we had a bad air conditioner in the previous hotel (Acte V), which can ruin a trip during a hot spell. The New Orient staff and hosts were incredibly attentive and friendly, the room was very nicely appointed and clean, and both the private and public spaces are extremely welcoming. The expected downside compared to our first hotel was supposed to be the greater distance to the riverside and left bank attractions, but to our surprise and delight, the New Orient’s location in the upper 8th was not a downside after all. It's in a tidy and peaceful part of the city, on a quiet street, with many nearby brasseries, boulangeries, shops and cafes that service the locals rather than catering just to tourists. It’s still easily walking distance to Montmartre or the Louvre or Tulleries Gardens, etc. And with several nearby metro/RER stops, getting around was a snap. If I return to Paris I will go straight back to the New Orient, and would enthusiastically recommend it to family, friends or colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “really nicely furnished and clean”
Reviews.Author: sarahzAustralia
Reviews.Content: lift was a little scary to negotiate with suitcase, due to the spiral staircase you had to step behind or down stair to open the lift door..lovely bakery on same street going to Villers station. Hotel staff were very helpful. rooms very clean Lovely tiny balcony so you could open the door for fresh air. Air con very quiet and lovely comfortable bed. Good location and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The Icing On The Cake!!”
Reviews.Author: m_bolinao
Reviews.Content: The "New Orient Hotel" was "perfect" for our first trip to Paris. Being the first time to Europe for that matter I really did not know what to expect from this establishment, but after staying there for four nights and as evidenced from the positive feedback I provided it was just that PERFECT!! The location of the hotel with close proximity to the Metro (Villiers Station), many surrounding restaurants, a grocery/convenience store across the street, bakeries galore and a well fitted out laundrette across the street and a couple of stores down made for a perfect stay. Before I go any further I really should mention how friendly the staff were and how they were really there to help me and my partner in our stay at Paris. Unable to speak French there really wasn't a language barrier at all as we could communicate with them in English. The room we stayed in was a Superior Twin Room as all the double rooms had been booked out. But because we were on a budget and bookings were made very last minute, Micheline was able to speak to the owners who were happy to offer me the Superior Twin Room at the same price of the Double Room for the four nights. They also arranged for the two beds to be joined together for us as well. On arrival after our train ride from Amsterdam we were glad to make it to our accomodation. But on opening the door to our room we were presented with our own little bit of Paris. Honestly I was surprised by the size of the room, the fitout and cleanliness of it. I don't know how the star rating works in Paris but this was nothing like what I would expect from a two star hotel. The accomodation I would say personally was four stars, maybe it's things like room service which aren't provided which make it a two star, but when you're in Paris who needs room service. I could go on forever about how good this place is but I won't as I'll leave you to find out for yourselves. I know one thing however and that is when I come to Paris next I'll definitely be staying at the New Orient Hotel and I'll be recommending my friends do as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; charming and well located”
Reviews.Author: schulzkeil
Reviews.Content: The New Orient hotel is situated in a neighborhood where traditionally music instrument makers reside. Next to the hotel are violin makers, trombone dealers and repair shops, etc. The neighborhood is almost ideally located behind the St. Lazare station, surprisingly close on one side to the old opera house and the grands boulevards with the famous department stores, and on the other to the Champs Elysées. The hotel has recently been renovated. The rooms are quiet with air conditioning and not as small as one expects in two star Paris hotels. The room rates are reasonable, and the atmosphere in the hotel was very agreeable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique French hotel in Paris - highly reco”
Reviews.Author: mlaw423
Reviews.Content: Loved New Orient Hotel and recommend it to anyone looking for a small boutique hotel in Paris. About a 3 min walk from the Villiers or Europe metro stations in the 8th Arr, 7 min walk from Gare St Lazare. Checked in at 11pm and front desk guy was super nice and helpful. We stayed in room 13 on the 3rd floor with a balcony and remodeled bathroom (see pics). Small room but very nice, clean and perfect for me and wife. I've stayed at Best Westerns in Paris (which are everywhere and one is just a block away from New Orient) and for the price, New Orient is a great choice. 115EUR/night in summer time. Wifi was excellent quality, breakfast was nice but not free, service was great and friendly. Quiet neighborhood at night and most of the guests we saw were businessmen and a few older tourist couples. I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value in a warm and charming setting.”
Reviews.Author: RAvanti
Reviews.Content: A true "hotel de charme", with kind and thoughtful service, impeccable rooms, and very reasonable pricing, the Hotel New Orient is conveniently located and staffed by exceptionally pleasant, helpful people who make one feel immediately at home. Free wi-fi is a welcome bonus. I have stayed here on several occasions and never had anything but an exceptionally pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LindiSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Rooms and bathrooms were spotlessly clean. Lovely large shower. Beautiful view from balcony windows. Quiet and very comfortable. Only downside was the small size of the room but for 4 nights and the amount of time actually spent in the room, was not a major issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: jldut
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It is very small but this is expected in europe. Right across the road from a supermarket and within a 5 minute walk of a metro station. Staff were very friendly - sometimes you cant always expect this in france, but they were very friendly here. Breakfasts were really nice, best ones we had while travelling! Free internet a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ForeignFun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Orient once again and found it better than ever. We really like the welcoming atmosphere and charming decor - typically Parisian! It really is a lovely boutique hotel with attractively furnished rooms, good bath/shower with quality fittings in a good location. Although the big stores are nearby, we like to go in the opposite direction to see the market stalls and local shops at the end of the street - e.g. Le Notre bakers with their great cakes; the fishmonger with the wonderful seafood display; the cheese and oil shop, etc. The only disappointment was we couldn't go earlier because they were fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “New Orient is Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: proteons
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the New Orient Hotel. The room we stayed in had a balcony over- looking the street with a flower box on the railing. The bathroom was clean. The bed was firm and clean. The ceiling was high. There was free wifi. If you didn't bring a laptop like me, they have a computer you can use for free in the lobby. There is a small market across the street, which was very convenient. There is also a boulangerie 1/2 block away that serves delicious pastries. I had the best raisin croissants. The metro was close by too. The staff at the hotel were friendly and very helpful. We will definitely return on our next trip to Paris. Merci New Orient!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ele423
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at the New Orient Hotel. My boyfriend and I were traveling from the US, and we do not speak French. The staff at the hotel was so helpful to us with translation and directions. The hotel provides a great value for the price and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bonnlieber
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the New Orient many times, usually with family. Their family room is a great deal, as are the smaller rooms. Clean, bright, free WiFi, decent breakfast (costs extra), quiet street. That and great value, what more could one want? Highly recommended for families and single travelers. The only downside is that it is in 8th -- but only steps from the Villiers metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: celi1782
Reviews.Content: No complaints what so ever for this hotel. I stayed there for 3 nights and it was just right. The location is perfect…walking distance to metro, shopping, outdoor market. If you head down boulevards de Rome you can literally walk 5 minutes to Haussmann street to the great department stores and from their continue walking to just about all major tourist sites. I traveled alone and felt super safe. The hotel offers free wifi and a free computer to use in the reception area. This hotel locks its door after a certain time at night so you can only get in if you get buzzed in reception. I found this safe as I noticed the hotel next door had its door wide open. The room was very clean and perfect. Hotel rooms in Paris are small to begin with, but this one has enough room. Last yr I was in a hotel across the street and it pretty much was tiny with moldy carpet from an overflowing tiny shower. So when I walked into this room I was happy to see hardwood floors and a nicely spaced out washroom. It is still small compared to hotel rooms in other countries but it really was conveniently spaced out. The staff was very helpful when I had any questions or any problems. On the day of my departure my shuttle did not arrive on time and the reception desk was very nice in making sure I find a cab to head to the airport. Fyi if you are planning to book a shuttle always book it for a little bit earlier then you would like to arrive in case they are delayed, which usually is the case. So again, great location, helpful staff, and clean rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Calm”
Reviews.Author: wrexondaf
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night in this hotel and had a comfortable quiet night. Slept in till 9am without any disturbance which is unusal in centre of Paris. Room and bed were very clean and shower excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a budget price!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ErnieG2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had scheduled a different hotel and after reading all the negative reviews about it (here in Trip Advisor) we decided to cancel that reservation. We noticed this Hotel Ad on the website, and after reading all the reviews, decided to book it for 7 days. Don't regret on booking at this hotel!!! Simply perfect! Perfect location and even so close to the St. Lazare train station, you couldn't hear the trains coming in or heading out, metro station is only about 5 min walk from the hotel. Very friendly staff!!!, very clean hotel, to the point that you can smelled the nice smell from the corner before getting to the hotel!!!!!. Room was big enough for us and even with the luggage on the way, we could walk around them without problems. The price for breakfast (about 7 euros per person) was cheaper than eating breakfast out!!! The hotel simply stands out from the other hotels around the area, to the point that next door there is a hotel and it wasn't until the day before we check-out that we noticed it. Definitely this will be our hotel to stay on our next trip to Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: Foodforfriends
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a Valentines weekend away and to celebrate our twelfth wedding anniversary after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and were delighted with our choice. The best thing about this hotel is the friendly and helpful service from everyone who worked there, not something I have experienced in Paris before even when staying in a 5 star hotel. The size of the room was more than adequate and we had a bath and a small balcony (although much too cold to stand on it!). Everywhere was also very clean and the decoration was tasteful and charming. We had breakfast in the hotel (7 euros) as this turned out to be cheaper and better than the one breakfast we had in a cafe which cost 8.5 euros and we had very surly, almost to the point of being rude, service. Hotel is in a quiet area but with supermarket opposite and metro and train station within easy walking distance. I do not think we will stay anywhere else in Paris on on future visits. Recommend a tour of the Opera House and our 4 hours allocated to the Louvre just wasn't enough!

Reviews.Title: “smart and great location”
Reviews.Author: gaycoupleSuffolk
Reviews.Content: first time visit to lovely independant hotel in great location in the classical music quarter - very welcoming and helpful reception team both night and day - especially the lovely Micheline! rooms are not large but all spotlessly clean, tidy, comfy and quiet, furnished with traditional/individual furnishings - very warm considering how cold it was outside - good continental breakfast to set you up for the day near Europe and Rome metro and feels very french as not in main stream tourist sector but everywhere so accessible do visit the local weekend street market (turn right out of entrance and walk across main boulevard and it is straight ahead) - fabulous french patisseries, vegetables, flowers etc and no other tourists - superbe! and if you go to the major "flea market" in the north of the city, be warned to ignore/avoid the trashy stands you reach first and make sure you go beyond and under the bridge where the most amazing maze of antiques, vintage clothes, jewellery etc can be found - complete aladins cave of surprises, not cheap but great fun to browse do buy a 3/5 day transport pass as makes getting from A - B so easy, reception has every sort of tourist map, brochure and whats on information and will help book restaurants, taxi etc will definately return and highly recommend for value for money and location

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, charming hotel at an incredible value.”
Reviews.Author: lovegoodfood10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the New Orient during a two night stay in Paris en route home from Morocco. I had searched dozens of hotels before deciding on New Orient based on a New York Time review and positive comments on Trip Advisor. We found the hotel easily after taking the train from CDG to Gare du Nord and then on to Villiers metro station. We were so delighted to see our room, which was of ample size with a large comfortable bed and small details that makes one say "this is so French!" The bathroom seemed newly renovated and was sparkling clean. There were towels hung over a radiator on the wall so they were warm after my bath. I have heard many complaints from people about rude staff in other hotels and I must say that the staff at the New Orient was wonderful! Everyone we met was friendly, patient, and welcoming. We just adored this hotel and highly recommend it. Although it is a little distant from the main tourist district, everything is accessible by subway. We liked that it is tucked away on a quiet street. I prepaid our room at a non refundable rate which made this a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: YMLUK
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. The location is great - the hotel is about 5 minute walk to Saint Lazare station, close to department stores like Printemps and Galeries Lafayette, and the Opera Garnier. To the north of the hotel is Villiers metro station, and the neighborhood around it is really lively with numerous bakeries, butchers, tabacs, grocers, etc. Oh yes, there is also a supermarket in front of the hotel as well. The room was clean and tastefully decorated, although quite small. We had a double room with shower. The shower room with sink was located in the opposite corner from the toilet, which was a little bit awkward (you would have to walk through the room to wash your hands). Our room looked out to a little courtyard surrounded by other apartment buildings, and it might be a good idea to request a room facing the road if possible. Over all, great place for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel box of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid929
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in the fall for several days. What a charming hotel! Our room was, like most in Paris, very tiny but it was adorable. It was decorated with antiques and had a balcony big enough for us both to sit and enjoy a glass of wine. We liked the neighborhood. A bit off the tourist track but so easy to walk to the Metro that it hardly mattered. The staff is outstanding. They take great pride in their hotel and in pleasing their guests. We hardly wanted to leave!

Reviews.Title: “gem of a find!”
Reviews.Author: dantipolo
Reviews.Content: this quaint and charming hotel deserves all the thumbs up below. it is really a gem of a find in a sea of many options. the room was just about the right size with small reminders that you are indeed in paris. immaculately clean, and given a two thumbs up by my wife, it stayed that way all throughout our stay. the hotel staff we have interacted was just warm and quite helpful. it was an honest welcome as if a friend has visited their lovely home. centralised airconditioning might not work for everyone but it was ok for us. location was superb as it is near a metro with a small grocery shop in front. musicians would love the area as we stumbled upon small shops crafting violins and guitars, musical notes/books nearby. just be wary of thin walls that a hip-hop loving neighbor might play in the most ungodly hour. nothing a quick call to monsieur at the front desk cant fix. we are already plotting our return to new orient hotel in spring.!

Reviews.Title: “lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: singoLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have just came back from our stay in Paris and had a lovely stay at this hotel. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone, the staff are very polite and helpful and the location is close to the metro station Villiers. The rooms are small but comfortable and very clean. It is also close to lots of little cafe's and shops. It is approx 30 mins walk from the Champs elysees but only 5 mins on the metro. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled by this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreoBob
Reviews.Content: We'd done our research on affordable hotels in Paris and chose the New Orient based on what we had read, and we were absolutely delighted. It lived up to our hopes and expectations. The staff are friendly and helpful, the room (we went for the balcony option) was absolutely fine, and the continental breakfast was excellent (Mmm - those yummy dark brown rolls !!) Madame suggested a local Restaurant "Le Coin" for an evening meal, and we would heartily recommend this place to others - it provides good honest french food and is very busy with local customers (always a good sign) The location meant that we could walk to most of the sights of Paris, and the area felt safe and friendly. The little supermarket directly opposite is really handy for odds & ends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ciara3247
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (quite close to Villiers metro station) in a quiet and lovely neighborhood. Restaurants and a grocery store (Monoprix) are available close by (Rue de Levis). We felt very safe walking around the area at night. Two-person room with bath was a decent size and had a lovely balcony view over the street. Overall, a perfect place to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay great value”
Reviews.Author: wasta22
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel; Nice and very helpful Staff, room and bathroom are very clean, good location, great price. We need clean and reasonably priced hotel and we got that plus more here. A true representation of a European hotel, small room but we hardly stayed in the room we left early morning and did not return till we were ready to go to bed. I would stay her again, if you are traveling on a budget you will not find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for money in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JPHWatford
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many mid range hotels in Paris, the New Orient probably takes top marks, all things considered. I stayed two nights on my own for 93 euro per night. I did not take breakfast. I was given a room on the sixth floor at the rear of the building. Take the lift! The main plus points? Firstly the comfort of the bed. I am a big bloke but slept like a baby. Excellent quality of linen. Also the room was so clean. If you had told me the bathroom was newly installed I would have believed you. the quality of the room clean was superb. The bathroom dazzled the same on my departure as it had doneon my arrival. I didnt hesitate to book again for my next visit. Its really handy for Saint Lazare station, Parc Monceau is just a five minute walk and there are plenty of nice cafes and restaurants on hand. An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean room in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: traveltripak
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay here with my husband. We arrived in Paris having read the reviews for this hotel, but not booking it since we were flying standby. Upon arriving, we stopped at an internet cafe and saw that there was still availability and since it was our first trip together and we didn't know where else to look we went ahead and booked this room. The reviews were spot on for this hotel. We lucked into a 100 Euro per night special, so it seemed like a great deal for a very clean, quiet hotel. The rooms may be small, but we've definitely had smaller rooms in other European countries. We had an actual double bed, a desk, an armoire and two little nightstand ledges for books, glasses, etc. Our bathroom was nice and fresh with a shower and sink/vanity and toilet. This hotel is close to the both the Europe and Villiers metro stops and we felt very safe arriving at any time of day or night. It seemed to be a little farther walk to places then is mentioned on the website, but it is so easy to take the metro, that we most often did that. If you don't mind staying in a quiet area, this is a great hotel. If you want a little more lively area to just step out into, this is probably not the best choice. But again, it's so easy to get places via the close metro stops (both of which took bills in the ticket machines!) that it really doesn't matter. We didn't stay for breakfast, so I can't comment on that, but the breakfast room looked nice. The staff were all very nice and lovely. The free wifi was GREAT! The balcony was charming. They even have a computer in an old phone booth should you need it.

Reviews.Title: “When visiting Paris, a nice place to call home”
Reviews.Author: sjs033
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 days in Paris...wow! A friend had recommended the hotel, and I wasn't disappointed. The price was right, 120 euros for the bath/shower combo, very clean room, hardwood floors, small desk, free WI-FI, brand new bathroom, amazing shower head with great water pressure, fresh white linens and two balcony's. The hotel is about a 5-6 minute walk from the metro station. And another 15-20 minute walk from the Arc. There are several little places to grab breakfast, lunch or dinner in the area. Most importantly, if you are staying for any length of time, there is a laundrymat across the street and about 4 doors down. Very very convenient. Wish I had known this before I left, I would have even brought fewer clothes with me. The staff are very friendly and helpful.
