Someone is always at the front desk to greet you and answer any questions you may have. The hotel is located on a very quiet street, and if you can get a room with a balcony, it's great. It really adds to the charm of the hotel and allows you to listen to the sounds of the city. Sure, the rooms are on the small side, but that's Paris. I had definitely considered staying in a chain hotel, specifically Best Western, Marriott or Hilton. But for this price, and the friend's recommendation, I am glad I went with the New Orient. What's the point of going to Paris to stay in an "American Hotel". I traveled by myself, and felt very safe walking from the metro to the hotel late in the evening. I would definitely stay at the New Orient Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian charm”
Reviews.Author: fiddlemkr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the New Orient Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room, although small, were neat and clean. We had a room with a balcony, which added a lot of charm. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're not particular about having the grandest Hotel room to stay in....”
Reviews.Author: luckytravellerash
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm not dissing the place, but please what was with the tiny cubicles they called rooms. But I guess thats what you get for 100 Euros a night in Paris. We were never in the room for more that a few hours..... slept..woke up...showered and then out the whole day , back .... changed for a nice dinner ...... slept .... and the whole process again. We were there for 2 days. Called in for coffee the next morning, they sent us a whole basket of crossiants+juice+coffe+jams+butter ...... loved it , but ofcourse they charge us 22 Euro for that ( 11x2).... I already knew that breakfast was 11 euro per head, but come on , for 22 euro , I could have had a bigger and better breakfast outside the hotel room. Whatever... was suprised to have gotten charged for 2 crossiants and 3 loaves of bread and juice and jam... tiny jam bottles. Just watch out there!!!! But apart from that, it was all good... .............by the end of the trip , the very nice host ( the younger man) suggested that we learn more French.......... !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Really..... coming from a man who didnt know more than few words in English........... I was ticked off because EVERYTHING IN FRANCE IS IN FRENCH...... EVEN THE EXPLAINATIONS FOR PAINTINGS IN THE LOUVRE WERE IN ...........FRENCH.... very global of the french..... so they are the ones that need to introduce a few more languages in their lives.... not me.... who already knows 4 languages.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELADIX
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff & clean rooms. The beds were so comfortable. We loved our balcony. The price was excellent by Paris standards. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean and stylish. The whole package !”
Reviews.Author: Jemima71
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother and sister in law and I have just come back from a 2 night stay at the New Orient, after choosing it from the good reviews we read on here. I have to say that we were not at all disappointed. We had a friendly welcome on arrival, very easy check-in and the rooms were beautiful. Each one has a different style and colour theme, the decoration looks new and the bathroom was clean and bright. OK so the rooms are not UK Travelodge size, but we could walk all the way around the bed, had room for a suitcase and other bags on the floor, and that was in addition to the table, two chairs and a wardrobe. The area around the hotel is great. It's quiet with some beautiful old buildings and it only took about 30 minutes to walk down to the Seine. There are 3 metro stops within easy walking distance. We used Villiers mostly which was a 3 minute walk form the hotel. All in all we were extremely pleased with our choice and would definitely recommend the New Orient to anyone who wants calm, cleanliness and simple stylishness.

Reviews.Title: “A great find - don't tell everyone!!!”
Reviews.Author: amyjackson100
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Really nice people, very clean, good location, great price. I don't need "plush"; I need clean and reasonably priced and I got that plus more here. A true representation of a European hotel. Be sure to leave your key at the front desk when you come and go so you don't lose it - like I did!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Buoyant130
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend. Though a bit away from the major attractions of Paris, there is a Metro station just down the road and Gare St Lazare was only a few minutes walk away. So its still easy to get to things and plenty of good shopping for those inclined not too far away. The staff were friendly and our room, though typically Parisian small, was nevertheless clean, comfortable and though basic, it was nicely fitted out. We did not breakfast there as it was not included in the room charge but we easily found somewhere near Gare St Lazare. All in all a very commendable, reasonable value and we'd happily go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “New York Times got it right”
Reviews.Author: GreenApple07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights after reading the review on the New York Times. Since we frequently travel to Paris, we didn't have high expectations given the low cost of the rooms but we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are decent size (no frills, simple rooms decorated in antique-like furniture) and the shower was small but clean. The staff were friendly and eager to help and the internet on the ground floor beside the reception was free. The supermarket across the street made it easy to stock up on water. The location of the hotel is pretty central - you can access the hotel by getting on and off at the following metro stops: Europe, Villiers and St. Lazare. All in all, this hotel is a gem and we'll be returning on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant trip to Paris in a briliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: l238284
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the New Orient for 2 days early October after seeing the hotel advertised in my City Paris tourist book, and I was not disappointed. I was looking for something fairly cheap but with a traditional french feel and that is what we got. The hotel is located 5 mins walk from Villiers metro stop and is on a ittle street that looks out on to small apartments and shops. The staff were lovely, they spoke excellent english and unlike some places in Paris didnt mind using it! They were incredibly helpful, friendly and welcoming. The room was small by english hotel standards, but adequate for what we needed, and very clean and modern with laminate flooring and a small balcony with little flower boxes. The bathroom was brandnew and lovely and clean. All in all we had a lovely stay in Paris and I would definately recommend this hotel for anyone wanting an affordable, quaint, comfortable hotel to use as a base to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Experience life as a Parisian”
Reviews.Author: TheQueenslander
Reviews.Content: For the global traveller, Parisian (for that matter, European) hotels can be awkward, small and bare - as if adding insult to injury, accompanied by ridiculous tariffs for what you get. Hotel New Orient is primarily value for money, suited to easy going tourists who want a clean room with clean facilities and a safe neighborhood to stay in. Positioned 300 m from Villiers Metro, ATMs, pubs and casual local restaurants, it offers the experience of life as a local. Walking through nearby daily market streets like Rue de Levis, purchasing baguettes and pastries and browsing bric-a-brac added a dimension often lost to tourists in 5-star hotels and those only strolling the Champs Elysees. We found breakfast at the store across the road and from the nearby markets selling fresh food every morning. Admittedly the mid-staircase 3-man (or one-man + 2 bags) elevator is unusual, but understandable as a retrofit to an old building; the beds are comfortable and our bathroom fixtures brand-new. The air-conditioning does appears set for the whole building which can be irritating, but easy access to 2 balconies in our room helped with breeze. It can be noisy with light traffic easily heard from 6 am. Daily servicing meant clean, tidy rooms to come home to. There is also free wi-fi internet access and public computer in the lobby. Their English speaking staff are helpful and are happy to recommend and book restaurants for you, as well as direct you as required. We found no problems with the Metro service, where a Metro station is within 500m of almost all the famous sites and museums. Compared with our other stay in a 4-star hotel, we got the same small-sized room, bed and small bathroom and distance to the Metro, as this 2-star. Sure their furniture was nicer and location more prestigious, but we paid 3 times as much. In Euro, that's a lot. There are definitely more beautiful places to stay than the New Orient, but be prepared to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohmyGOSH
Reviews.Content: This hotel was highly praised in a New York Times article as a great bargain and that it is. It is a two star hotel. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. BAth clean and modern. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast was good too. The neighborhood is a few metro stops away from the main tourist areas but it is a very nice residential neighborhood. Small family run restaurants where we were the only tourists. The morning markets up the block were a real treat. We walked amongst Parisians purchasing the ingedients for their weekend meals. We felt like we were expereinceing another slice of Paris. It was kind of like being in Brooklyn when visiting New York. Great quallity of life expereince slightly off the main tourist area - which was fine for us. Only draw back is that is takes a few changes on the Metro to get back to the main tourist areas but this is no big deal unless you are high maintenance travelers. I highly recommend this hotel for folks looking for a good deal while visitng a wonderful city. We spent so little time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and romantic”
Reviews.Author: c-horse_norway
Reviews.Content: Very nice people running the hotel, we loved the clean bathroom and the lack of traffic in the street. Very good service helping us getting a taxi (the train-drivers were at strike). Short walk to Montmartre, and to the grand shopping magazines at blv. Hausmann. Nice breakfast included cereals and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and smoke-free”
Reviews.Author: Notrevealed
Reviews.Content: When we closed the double-paned windows of our fifth floor room facing the street, no outside noise of any kind penetrated our serene environment. One small drawback of this hotel – the elevator only stops mid-way between floors. However, the person at reception was happy to lug our bags up to it and we stopped above our floor to lug them down.

Reviews.Title: “High on charm, low on comfort”
Reviews.Author: TurtleBayNY
Reviews.Content: This is a very charming, quaint, very French hotel in a decent, convenient location. It's got restaurants closeby and is good for exploring Montmartre, which is a great area. But, otherwise, you pretty much need a subway or two to get anywhere. The Saint-Lazare station is good and closeby but you have to go deep underground, walk quite a lot inside the station and change at least once to get places. It is not half as conveinient as staying in the Latin Quarter, which is close to the museums, Notre Dame, the main gardens etc. As for the rooms, they were small (what do you expect in Paris) but had a good-sized armoire. The rooms were very charming as well. But, here's the downside. I was sleeping in my room and I woke up early in the morning to realize I couldn't turn the heat on because the hotel had not turned the heat on, claiming it was summer (it was September and in the 50's at night). In the morning, we woke up and begged the owner to turn the heat on, which he did after protesting that it was so warm outside. Who the hell are they to decide what's a comfortable temperature for me or for anyone else? They did not leave the heat on consistently and we had to ask for it repeatedly. Only the owner could turn the heat on and the guys at the front desk at night (typically when it got cold) had little clue about what we were asking for. Despite all the lovely charm of this quaint hotel, I did not have a good experience there.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: SpicynShellie
Reviews.Content: A lovely well kept 30 room hotel in a residential neighborhood in the 8th Arrondisement within walking distance to the Villier Metro. My room was tiny but clean and well maintained. Service was unobtrusive and professional. Even though located on a busy street it was quiet. The breakfast was not worth the $ since there are many cafes and brasseries with ambiance near by. The breakfast of 1 croissant, 1 roll, and 1 bain de chocolat with orange juice and bad coffee was $13EU. The lift is tiny and you have to be very careful when stepping on and off since the floor landing is very small and one could fall if not careful. Staff was helpful and polite at all times.

Reviews.Title: “A Bijou”
Reviews.Author: VioloncellePlayer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel in the luthier district of Paris enjoying a quiet, very comfortable room. Walked through the surrounding interesting neighborhoods as well as to the city center without any problems. Metro stops are also conveniently close. There is a small market directly across the street as well as a wonderful Lebanese Restaurant on the corner. Hotel staff were kind and friendly. Breakfast was fine. Would gladly return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jswan7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights in the New Orient Hotel in Paris from 10-16 August. We picked it from Trip Advisor's list after looking at several other hotels. It was our first stay in Europe, so from what I've heard the size of the room was average. We had enough room for our luggage, bed, bath, and ourselves. There was also a small desk and a nice wardrobe to hold our nicer clothes. Our room was only 108 euro/night and the window opened out onto a courtyard. Sepp & Catherine Wehrle (the owners) and several of their staff were excellent in communicating beforehand on e-mail to let me know about the room options and also how to get to the hotel from CDG. They were friendly and helpful with all of our questions and needs during our stay. The hotel is in an excellent location in a quiet neighborhood just blocks from either the Europe or Villiers Metro stations. We took the Roissybus to Opera and got on the Metro to our hotel from there. We were close to shopping, dining, and just southwest of the beautiful Montmarte neighborhood. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, pleasant place to sleep (the bed was quite comfortable and about the size of a US king-size mattress). It was nice to be able to get away from the very touristy areas, but they were always a quick subway trip away.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: rcrews
Reviews.Content: Truly a marvelous hotel with all the amenities and a gracious staff. Breakfast was awesome and convenient; not just bread and coffee but everything from fruit, cereal, and yogurt to croissants, hot chocoloate and tea. The staff helped us plan our daily excursions to the extent of calling to make reservations (recommended wonderful restaurants) or to get a cab. The rooms were cozy and romantic and the bathroom was immaculate and large. We loved our stay there. It made our Paris experience even more delightful than we imagined. I'm from Tennessee and that's why I can't truthfully say "Southern Hospitality in Paris!"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaKaren
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation here based on reviews read in TripAdvisor, as well as comments in a New York Times article. It was my first time in Paris, so I did not know what to expect. However, I wanted something safe, clean and reasonable in price, and this, from all reports, met all those criteria. It was perfect, I'd stay there again in a heartbeat! The rooms were small, as I expected, but exceptionally clean and tastefully furnished and decorated. My single room was on the sixth floor, and the circular staircase was a little scary at first as I am prone to vertigo, but I got used to it quickly (and there is a small elevator). The staff couldn't have been nicer, all of them that I met during my 11 days there were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. They also had a computer with internet access that they provided to clients at no additional charge. They did not have a restaurant, except for breakfasts, but they did have a small bar where beverages were available day and night. The location was excellent as well! It was safe, convenient, and I liked being somewhat away from the high-tourist area. There were numerous cafes and restaurants nearby, as well as a grocery store and laundromat across the street. Three metro stops were within just a couple of blocks, and it was walking distance to two of my favorite places, Parc Monceau and the Rue de Levy. I would definitely stay there again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Managers, Catherine and Sepp Wehrle, took 200 Euro for free”
Reviews.Author: DannyIsrael
Reviews.Content: On Match this year, I planed a visit to Paris on May and I was searching the web for a hotel that matches my needs and found this hotel and two others. I made a reservation in New Orient hotel as my first choice. Being sure with my choose I let them took 200 Euro from my Visa Card. A week latter I decided to change the hotel and made a new reservation in one of the two other hotels and of course canceled my reservation in New Orient hotel. I of course asked for my money back. Nevertheless the owners refused to give it back even though i was visiting there place twice during my visit in May and asked it face to face. Remember, all that was happened a month before my arrival and therefore no harm was made to the hotel by my cancellation. What should I do to bring my money back?

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: janny1
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel New Orient - we returned at the request of our two teenage children who loved it and the area the first time. The rooms are basic but spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We stayed in a family room with two double beds and bath/shower. As we booked late and arrived on Easter Sunday we had to have two rooms for our first night and then change room. This was straightforward as the staff moved all our bags while we were out for the day. The rooms were at the back of the hotel and whilst OK were not as nice as the ones at the front. They also only had showers and it is really nice being able to have a bath after a heavy days sight seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: ameslouise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for - tourist class hotel with quaint rooms, comfortable lobby and a local flavor. Don't be surprised by the lack of drawer space in the rooms, but the ample sized armoire gave us plenty of room. The rooms have newer windows that almost completely block any street noise. The bathroom was small but clean and nice with fantastic new shower heads (that were better than in some American 4 star hotels I have been in). Nearby conveniences include a grocery store across the street, laundry mat, liquor store, plenty of cafes (we particulary liked the Cafe Monceau) and the Villiers Metro stop with access to two lines just a couple blocks away. A pleasant surprise was the market street on Rue de Levis a few blocks away. Fruit, vegetable, meat and exotic food vendors are mixed in with WONDERFUL clothing stores, bakeries, etc. We didn't see many tourists in this area - just tons of locals doing their shopping. The general neighborhood was pleasant, clean, and not touristy at all. The staff at the hotel was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and making reservations for us. I highly recommend this hotel and will surely return on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: sa86
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times and have always been happy with it. The rooms are fairly spacious and very clean. The area is safe and there are a lot of cafes and restaurants to choose from. The metro (villiers) is just a few minutes away. The staff has always been very friendly and always remembered me. I dont recommend paying extra for the breakfast as there are many nearby cafes to choose from; and a bakery on the corner if you'd just like something quick. I highly recommend this hotel but be sure to book early during busy times as it fills up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: katyjane
Reviews.Content: The Hotel New Orient was a delight. Two adult couples were on the trip and we had not stayed there in the past. The rooms were clean, decorated beautifully, and had balconies with abundant flower boxes. The staff were delightful! Directions to local restaurants were great as well as city sites. They often gave us better ideas than the ones we had planned. The location is close (less than 5 minute walk) to two metro stations and also close to a major train station (the one that goes to Versailles). Several good bistros are close by as well as bakeries. A nice grocery store is directly across the street where you can get snacks and water. Breakfast is availabe for 10 euro if you tell them the night before. But there are little cafes close by that serve a better breakfast for less money. I loved the hotel and the owners and their staff. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was wonderfully located near three metro stops and metres away from the market in Rue de Levi, offering all you would expect in French gourmet delights. The room and bathroom were small as expected but clean,tidy & quiet. We had a little balcony to stand on and enjoy the typically parisien street below. The owners were a delight. They spoke English fluently and the desk was manned 24hours. They gave exceptional service even finding bike hire shops for us (and calling them) & booking resturants for us in French so we wouldn't miss out, drawing us maps etc. We will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “QUITE HORRENDOUS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have NEVER been treated in such a way in my life. First off, let me start by saying that I was excited to stay at this hotel after the reviews I had read previously. My friend and I were traveling Europe, and chose this hotel for our 2 night stay before we left for Italy. We arrived and realized that the hotel was tiny, and just barely average, but we weren't going to let it bother us. We went out that night, and came home at what we considered to be a reasonable hour while on vacation (130am). The man at the desk gave us filthy looks as we walked up the stairs and mumbled soemthing under his breath. We then got a call that we needed to go downstairs and speak to him. He started ranting and raving about he hated george bush, and then HE CALLED US PROSTITUTES. He said he didn't want "our kind" staying in his hotel (please keep in mind that we are both professional women in our 30's and were dressed extremely consevatively in jeans and long jackets). We were shocked and appauled and asked to speak to the manager. He refused, and started giggling smugly, and then told us that he was going to call the police!!! He then came out from behind the desk, and started screaming in our faces about only strippers staying out that late, and how we were students who loved George Bush (I still don't understand the Bush reference). It got to the point that we were scared to be in his presence (us being 2 women, and him being an extremely irate man, who was very beligerant and intense(we actually had to ask him to step back several times))At this point, we realized that we would never win, and went back upstairs to our room, where we could barely sleep we were so upset. so, if you are looking for a hotel where you will have a strict curfew, and won't feel safe, or comfortable...then I guess you have found the right one. I WOULDN'T WISH MY WORST ENEMY TO STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Guysfo
Reviews.Content: New Orient Hotel is a great hotel in a residential neighborhood. Safe place, close to metro (2 minute walk to the Villiers metro stop), and right across from a supermarket. There’s also a small Chinese restaurant, a brasserie, and a café within a couple buildings down. You can't really walk to the department stores (Lafayette and Printemps) but they're close by metro. Remember to get the 10% coupon for Printemps from the lobby and you can get a 10% coupon for Lafayette if you buy the Paris Visitors Pass at the metro. Our room was on the top floor with a balcony – the biggest room the hotel offers. We were very comfortable in it during out 7 night stay in Paris. The bathroom was a nice size – comparable to those in the US and it's new/recently remodeled. The people were very nice and speak English fluently. There were several TV channels – all in French but for one channel – CNN. I highly recommend staying at this hotel and will stay here again during our next trip. For first timers to Paris, a little tip... You have to pay to use the restrooms! 2 Euros at most places. Another option is to go to Quick (a local hamburger shop – like McDonald's) and buy a little drink. The pass code for the restroom is on the receipt. Also, restaurants are open late – 7 PM for most of them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: plod
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in July 2005, it was our second stay. website ---- Postives - good location. Not too far from metro, residential area - lots of restaurants close by (local ones, not tourist traps) - close to supermarkets, markets and laundrette - friendly and helpful staff who can speak many languages - excellent cleanliness and good service from chamber-maid - balcony out to street - good value Negatives - smallish rooms - no air-con (was OK with windows open, however, this let in a lot of traffic noise) I have recommended this hotel to many family and friends who have stayed in Paris and everyone has been happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Neighborhood Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. We were concerned about staying here after the bad review it received but decided to book it since it was recommended by another local hotel. I agree with the post that says it is basic with charm. The rooms have nice furnature. We found the complaints unfounded. It was very hot in Paris when we were there and they have not been able to install air conditioning but are working on it. Our room faced the street and the choice was: noisy and hot with the windows open or really hot with the windows closed. It was tough. The owners are working on it but have to work with the French government to get it done. If it will be hot then you may want to consider this. We found it very easy to get around Paris from the hotel. We liked that it was a neighborhood hotel instead of in the middle of a tourist area. We would stay there again and recommend it for the winter. Hopefully they will get their AC soon.

Reviews.Title: “braw hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was worried about finding a nice hotel for a first time trip to paris for my girlfriends birthday but the new orient hotel contributed to making the trip memorable for both of us. The hotel is basic, but has lots of character!!! the website gives you a good idea of what the hotel looks like, the rooms are basic but clean!!!! and if you can book a room with a balcony its a bonus. The area is very nice and within easy reach of the subway. We found it difficult using the subway at first to find the hotel but after initial confusion got there and the New Orient is within easy reach of all the main city centre tourist attractions. There is also a very good lebanese restaurant a hundred yards or so on the other side of the street from the hotel. If you are sightseeing and looking for a nice place to stay at a reasonable price then I highly recommend it! Slainte Mhath Ross
